npcs.name: Accountant Melet
utterances: If you don't have pressing business with me, then please be on your way.  I have work to get done.
...sigh... Yes?  Can I help you?
Very well then, out with it.  I have other things to be doing.
And how am I supposed to know this?  I don't have any requisition lists to even know what to send!
That's what I just said!  If you want something sent, I need those orders.

I don't know!  Well... okay, come to think of it, I heard the guards scuffling with someone outside here not too long ago.  Whoever it was got away, but the courier they attacked was doing a run between here and the palace, and that might have something to do with the missing lists.  I have other things to worry about, so I really didn't pay it much attention.
Look who is back!  Do you have those lists?  I can't send a thing without them.
Eh, doesn't matter to me.  I just need those lists to send anything out.  Okay, let me look over these...

All right, everything seems to be in order.  The Queen wants medicine, blankets, and food sent over there immediately.  I'll get them on their way, but there's an issue.  I can't send out all of the food that's requested here.  I haven't received an expected delivery from the farmers in Antonica.

npcs.name: Aeris Lightwind
utterances: My price is always right. Please take a look!
Sometime, I do miss the cool breeze at the harbor...
Hello there! I bet I have the item that you need.

npcs.name: Aesthetic Winchester
utterances: Hail to you, fair citizen.  May your day be filled with discovery!

Well done, my friend!  It's obvious that your group's potential could be put to better use elsewhere.  Seek out the Exalted Milanthroo, and she will have more writs befitting the status of your guild.

npcs.name: Akina
npcs.purpose: High Warden of the Celestial Watch
utterances: The Celestial Watch keeps our eyes to the heavens, even as we watch over the citizens of Qeynos.

npcs.name: Aldermun
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Alfred Ironforge
utterances: I'm sorry, until you have chosen a specialty in your craft I do not have any work orders for you.  Come see me when you're more practiced in your trade.

npcs.name: Algernon
utterances: Alright, all right.  I'll see what we have on the market now.  Just hold your horses and I'll be with you in a minute!
All right here's all the goods listed in the city.  If you find anything you want, let me know.

npcs.name: Allysha Lanne
utterances: Gems and rocks, that is my specialty! I also bake a mean jumjum pie don't ya know!

npcs.name: Ambassador Duryo Valstath
utterances: Greetings!  I am here to offer assistance if you wish to change citizenship.  Is this of interest to you?

As you're probably aware, Qeynos has established good relations with the cities of Kelethin and New Halas, and when someone wishes to switch citizenship to those cities we try to make the process as friendly as possible. Is this your wish?
I would be happy to help.  Are you interested in becoming a citizen of Kelethin, or New Halas?

npcs.name: Amren Talbot
utterances: Focus is the key to unlocking any illusion.  The mind's eye can do many wondrous things, once it focuses.

npcs.name: Amund MacRae
utterances: How's it goin'?
Listen, I already paid what I owe, that game weren't fair... wait... who'd you say?
Oh!  I heard that goddess was a hot one!  Pro'lly looked twice as good as one of them serving fillies at the tavern.  And those girls can make you howl!
If I ain't out slicing some beast with me axe, that's where you'll find me.  Cards, ale, and fillies –can't get better than that!

npcs.name: Apprentice Librarian Cippin
utterances: I wonder sometimes how these people ever kept this library organized!  There are books everywhere!

npcs.name: Ardath Bay
utterances: I've got a treat for ya!  Ha!  Ha!  Ha!
I'm not celebrating Nights of the Dead.  This is what I always wear!

npcs.name: Aren Firerain
utterances: What brings you to the Temple of Life, <player name>?

npcs.name: Aristide Calais
utterances: Hello, adventurer.  Please keep your voice down in here.  You wouldn't want to disturb a mage in the middle of his or her studies...

npcs.name: Arthin Dawnhammer
utterances: While their fellow citizens struggle against the tides of evil, the Tunarian Alliance worries itself with the plight of soulless plants and animals.
The Qeynos Guard blindly strikes at the darkness rather than see the opportunity for redemption that lies within even the most lost of us.
The Ironforge Exchange neglects the spiritual through its devotion to the physical materials and pleasures of this world.
The Celestial Watch preserves the rituals of servitude to the gods so that all might experience through worship the return of the ancient deities.
Were they to encounter a god, the Concordium would drop their staves and bow before the might of a true power.

npcs.name: Ashtur Lawton
utterances: Better a distant good than a near evil.

npcs.name: Assistant Rystan
utterances: Bellengere the Three has set much upon my schedule today.  I have no time for chit-chat.  I apologize.

npcs.name: Astrynia Burnwynd
utterances: Good day to you, fellow student of wizardry.  It's amazing to see how many of us have talents for the arcane.

If you find items that add to your intelligence or stamina, then take them!  Intelligence affects your spell focus and increases the damage your spells can cause.  Your stamina affects your health.  This is crucial.

Know your strengths and hone them!  We can unleash the purest forms of destruction upon our foes by harnessing the arcane powers of fire and ice.  This is true whether you are battling a single opponent or a group.
Rely not on your defenses.  You are stronger than that!  There is no need to concern yourself with defenses when your foe has been slain by the devastating elements!
Greetings <player name>, what brings you to the Concordium?

npcs.name: Atiyah Kaddor
utterances: Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Welcome! What can I help you with?
Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!

npcs.name: Attendant C'thrius
utterances: I should have been made a Steward. My rank as an Attendant is an insult.
The accident wouldn't have happened if I weren't surrounded by neophytes. We could have prevented it.

npcs.name: Augur Prichard Fizzburn
utterances: I'm afraid I cannot speak now, friend.  Please feel free to avail yourself of our knowledge.  Right now, the city requires my concentration.

<player name>! You return and look to be fully operational as well. I'm up to my blorkfimbles in research documentation so I don't require your services at this time. However, I do want to express my utter gratitude for all the hard work you and your guild have done for the Concordium. There are terrible dangers afoot in the Overrealm and the research materials you've brought us helps figure out just what we are dealing with.

npcs.name: an awestruck Qeynos resident
utterances: See! We never needed Freeport's help! Queen Antonia can do it all on her own!
I know there are those who wish harm upon Qeynos, but I just feel sorry for them.
I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
We must not doubt Queen Antonia. We owe much to her leadership!
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
May the gods continue to bless us.
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
The night sky is so different now, I love it!
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Qeynos can't accomplish!
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, Queen Antonia wouldn't let any harm come to us.
Luclin shines so bright...
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.
Freeportians will learn the errors of their ways, one day.

npcs.name: Azima Kaddor
utterances: Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Welcome! What is it I can help you with?
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!

npcs.name: Baker Voleen
utterances: With the Copperpots joining us, our baked breads are now twice as good!
Tell me, do you prefer Halfling or Elven cuisine?  I myself have a hard time deciding between the two.
Welcome friend, welcome.  I hope you brought your appetite with you!
Unless you want to buy a treat, be on your way, friend.

npcs.name: Baron Kaedrin Ironforge
utterances: I am sure one of my many employees can attend to your needs, whatever they may be.
Excellent!  We are so fortunate that you were able to procure these from the Bloodsabers.  Thank you.

npcs.name: Barr
utterances: Duty above all else citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: a barred resident
utterances: I don't know what to make of all this chaos, leave me be.

npcs.name: Bartholomew Benson
utterances: You are an adventurer aren't you? I bet you have been through lots of battles!
This looks like the perfect day for an adventure! Take me with you!
One day I will be a hero of Qeynos... You'll see!
Can you take me with you on your adventures?

npcs.name: Bauer
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Bekker
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Beldrin Findlebolt
utterances: Hail to you, <player name>.
Oh, what's it to be?  Looking to get some mechanical contraption to work again, or is it something new to be cobbled and crafted?
You're not here to hire me for my services?  I am a grand tinkerer.  I can make any mysterious what's-it work again!
Besides tinkering?  Uh... I love good food!  Tinkering is very difficult on an empty stomach.

npcs.name: Bellengere the Three
utterances: If knowledge is power, and power corrupts, then it is only logical to presume that knowledge corrupts.  Rubbish, I say.  The fundamental flaw in this theory is that power corrupts, whereas it should be stated that it CAN corrupt.  This is the most important lesson to learn when using the arcane forces... as you use its power, it can as easily use you.  Take heed of this warning, friend.
All the knowledge of the universe can be yours with The Concordium. But there is little time for research, and I must call upon my most talented students to carry out some very specific tasks for me.

Surely you've heard of the strife gripping our fair city? A different malady afflicts every corner, and Queen Antonia sits idly on her throne brokering deals with Freeport. It falls on the Circle to correct her blunders and repair the damage.

With its vast magical resources, The Concordium is uniquely capable of solving problems of an arcane nature. Demonic forces have opened portals into the heart of Baubbleshire, and threaten to metastasize into the rest of the city. Your own powers are not insignificant; can I trust you to deal with this threat?

Do not worry, I would not send one I thought incapable. The brunt of their forces have not yet emerged, so your job for the time being is merely to stop their advance scouts. While doing so, I need you to collect samples of the earth and debris near their portals, that we might study the magic used to open them. We should then be equipped to close the portals and end the threat for good.

npcs.name: Bermo
utterances: All manner of fermented beverages available here, all with my special Glowmyst juice added!
It's a special juice I squeeze from the glowmyst beetles and I'm running short on the stuff; my customers love it.  Hey, you're a stout one, would you mind squeezing me some?

You must go to the Oakymyst forest and harvest the beetles. I'll need at least a handful of the beetles -- their juice doesn't add to or take away from the flavor of my drinks, but it gives them a slight, radiant glow.
I must have my glowmyst! My customers won't settle for anything other than that glowing concoction!
Great! This will last at least a week!  If you wait just a minute... Ahh, here we are!  Take some money for your troubles. I insist!

npcs.name: Blackhammer
utterances: Good day to you citizen, all preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Bleog Healbog
utterances: Hello there <player name>, what brings you to the Temple of Life this fine day?

npcs.name: Brandi Bender
utterances: Hello, there. How are you doing this fine day?

Oh dear, he did not!? He's a huge flirt, that one, but harmless really. You can't just approach someone and tell them you're using a pickup line on them, though. It defeats the purpose of attempting to compliment them.

Well, you have to just walk up and deliver the line to them. Yes, yes, I know it's a little embarrassing… Especially using lines you've received from Dalron, but you have to be confident and look the other person in the eye when speaking to them. You should be able to tell if they liked the compliment or not. Why don't you test out a few lines on me and see what I mean?
Ooh, Dalron can be such a typical male! That might be a nice compliment if I didn't already know where it was going. You'll have no luck picking anyone up with lines like that.
Why thank you, my sweet! They are one of my most striking features.
That's a joke, not a pickup line! Just stick to what's in the book Dalron gave you.

If only! But now you should have an idea of what sorts of lines to use, and if the recipient enjoyed them or not. I've already got a sweetheart for Erollisi Day, but why don't you head over to The Jewel Box, just northwest of here, and see if you can work your magic on Rex Ironforge. If nothing else, he should find your lines amusing.

npcs.name: a brightened Qeynos resident
utterances: I know there are those who wish harm upon Qeynos, but I just feel sorry for them.
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
Freeportians will learn the errors of their ways, one day.
May the gods continue to bless us.
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, Queen Antonia wouldn't let any harm come to us.
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Qeynos still stands.
We must not doubt Queen Antonia. We owe much to her leadership!
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
Luclin shines so bright...
See! We never needed Freeport's help! Queen Antonia can do it all on her own!
If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Qeynos can't accomplish!
I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.

npcs.name: Bruise Hotep
utterances: Enjoy the festivities while they last, adventurer!

npcs.name: Bulurg
utterances: The best part about this job is all the extra coin I get.
I spy that thou might enjoy a taste of mine brews made with real swamp water.  Wouldst this be the case?
I bet you have some stories, eh?  Adventuring must be an exciting life!
Oh dear, oh dear! The elven libation is dry.  If only all the locals would drink my bog spirits.
What can I get for ya?
Might I interest you in some meat and cheese to go with that tall glass of ale?

npcs.name: Burkin
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Candal Embret
utterances: Thanks for stopping to talk with us.

npcs.name: Caretaker Nogfizzle
utterances: I'm afraid you've surpassed the ability of this humble caretaker's teachings. Seek out Disciple Telas`velle when you're ready to continue your teachings.  Farewell!

npcs.name: Carey Meloy
utterances: Welcome to the bank, citizen. How can I assist you?
Are you interested in qualifying for an equity line of coin on your livestock?
Greetings, would you like to open an account or is there something else I can help with?
Has anyone told you about our new retirement savings programs?

npcs.name: Carol N'Freeling
utterances: Be wary, for some folks around here are only interested in tricks, not treats!

npcs.name: Casey
utterances: I plan to live out the rest of my life with my family here in Qeynos.

npcs.name: Celes
utterances: Welcome! What can I help you with?
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!

npcs.name: a Celestial Watch priest
utterances: Were they to encounter a god the Concordium, would drop their staves and bow before the might of a true power.
While their fellow citizens struggle against the tides of evil, the Tunarian Alliance worries itself with the plight of soulless plants and animals.

npcs.name: Cheris Alton
utterances: Thanks for stopping to talk with us.

npcs.name: Chizoba
utterances: What do we have here?  Another citizen concerned that I'm twisting the minds of young, impressionable magi?
That is what some would have you believe. Obviously, just because I have learned the art of coercion, I am incapable of being trusted and can be of no value to our city.

Oh, I'm certain if you ask around you'll hear voices that speak out against the skills Mistress Darlyner has been happy to teach.  Too many people prefer to focus on the fact she came here from Freeport.

There's the reaction I'm used to!  Yes.  Mistress Darlyner came here from Freeport.  Yes, she's a coercer. Yes, she announced who and what she was when she first arrived at the gates seeking asylum.  Yes, she's offered to teach others the magic of coercion.  How many spies have you ever heard of walk up to the guards and say "Here I am!"?

See?  So either a brilliant coercer who could have just magically charmed her way past the guards forgot she had access to such a spell, or she's been sent by Lucan D'Lere to openly teach the magi of his greatest rival the secrets to stopping him from using such power against them.  So which makes more sense to you?
So we agree.  Mistress Darlyner is not a spy, or at least not a very good one.  She's just freely exchanging knowledge of her trade for asylum. One can hardly fault her for that.
And she is definitely not training a cabal of magi to usurp control of the Council at the behest of Lucan D'Lere in a grand plot to deliver the city to his waiting hands.

Sorry, that was too easy to not have fun with.  You really shouldn't believe everything you hear.  Here's some free advice for fighting mind control from someone who knows: Think for yourself, when you do it's harder for others to think for you.

npcs.name: Chronicler Steelwill
utterances: Well done! Again and again you exceed the Concordium's expectations.  I'm afraid your guild's success has made you much more invaluable to Qeynos.  When you're ready, the Aesthetic Winchester wishes to speak to you.

npcs.name: a Circle of Ten Militia guard
Clerk Feld
utterances: I'm sorry, I don't have any business with you... maybe we can talk another time, though!
Why hello, there.  Are you looking to add some coins to your account?  Perhaps you want to invest in some hot properties?
All right, then!  I'll see what I can do to help.  What do you need to know?
Problem?  There's not a problem!  None at all!
Oh... well... of course not!  I haven't received an authorization!
Yes!  Yes exactly.  The Queen hasn't sent her authorization, and I can't very well start spending her money all crazy-like, now can I?  She'd jail me for sure!
Sorry no, not possible.  When I get her authorization, I'll send the money.
Ah, look who it is again.  Was there something else you needed?
Wait... what?  How did you... ?  Where did you come across that?
Well, I'm sure it must be a forgery... let me look at that.  Hmm... uh-huh.  Yes... Humph.
If it is a forgery, it is an exceedingly good one.  It appears that everything is in order.
No, you are.

This letter is clear.  "The bearer of this letter is entrusted to carry the necessary funds to ensure prompt and secure payment with the farmers of Antonica."  That sounds like she intended you to take this.  Unless you think this IS a forgery.
Perhaps, but you've got the letter, so you've got the responsibility.  Now, are we going to keep arguing the possibilities here, or should we get to work?
There is a place just outside of the city, near the aqueduct, where we do the trade off with the farmers.  It's not too far, and is easy to get to - I'll mark it on your map.
Look, I don't make the rules, I just convey how things operate around here.  Here is the payment.
Hello, and how can.. OH!  Umm... hello, again!  What can I do for you?
Oh, well, a bit, of course!  I had thought the matter with the farmer's payment would have been... handled.  There wasn't any further trouble, I trust?
I'm sorry, I don't think I know at all what you are talking...
You can't prove anything.  I have nothing to fear from you.
Wait, wait!  Okay hold on... I don't... I don't want to go to the prisons.  I have a family to feed!
I don't know...

No, truly!  I don't know.  While I was making my walk here about a week ago, I was approached by a strange man.  He said he represented someone with "interests" in seeing the refugee situation continue to get worse.

He led me back to his apartment, and I was surprised to find it filled with Bloodsabers!  He told me that I was to do certain favors for his parties, and in exchange for my silence and cooperation, he would see to it that nothing befell me or my family.
Well... not exactly.  I felt like it was a forceful offer, so to speak.  I didn't want to get too involved, so I took the offer and went about my business.
Oh no no no!!  I don't want this to fall back on me or my family!
Well... okay.  There you go.

npcs.name: Coalbeard
utterances: I hate the night shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Coldain Tradeskill Apprentice
utterances: Hello there!  I notice an air of mastery around you.  Are you an experienced tradesman?
My brethren and I have traveled to this temperate land in search of master craftsmen like you.  With our combined effort, we can craft truly astounding items!
You give me a roof over my head and access to your knowledge.  I will do all of the researching legwork, and once research is complete, I will share the recipe with you.  What do you say?

npcs.name: Collector Rattelis
utterances: Hello! If you happen to find the Cloak of Crystal Shards, Assassin Master's Cloak and Cloak of Runes upon your travels, please let me know. I'll make it worth your while!

npcs.name: Colt Longpier
utterances: Have we met?
Oh.  It's a little embarrassing, but I had asked for some dating advice some time back.  I guess that's why you're here.
Well, I have a bad temper, but don't worry; I only hit when I'm sober.  Ha ha ha!  No, seriously, I'm very much an outside guy.  Nights under the stars, hiking and sailing are rewarding activities.
I enjoy the camaraderie of both, but sometimes my empathy for animals gets in the way.  I can have such a soft spot for furry creatures.

npcs.name: a Concordium apprentice
utterances: While the Celestial Watch futilely awaits word from its forgotten gods the Concordium has harnessed the true power that blazes within each of us.
The Qeynos Guard cannot defend us from dark forces it neither sees nor understands.
The Concordium uses ancient and forgotten knowledge to protect us from the shadows that surround Qeynos.
Those who have neither the abilities nor the aspirations to pursue the intellectual arts will find a home at the Ironforge Exchange.

npcs.name: a Concordium mage
utterances: The Concordium uses ancient and forgotten knowledge to protect us from the shadows that surround Qeynos.
The Qeynos Guard cannot defend us from dark forces it neither sees nor understands.
Those who have neither the abilities nor the aspirations to pursue the intellectual arts will find a home at the Ironforge Exchange.

npcs.name: a Concordium scholar
utterances: The Qeynos Guard cannot defend us from dark forces it neither sees nor understands.
While the Celestial Watch futilely awaits word from its forgotten gods the Concordium has harnessed the true power that blazes within each of us.
Those who have neither the abilities nor the aspirations to pursue the intellectual arts will find a home at the Ironforge Exchange.

npcs.name: Corryn Menai
utterances: Another lovely day in the city of Qeynos!

npcs.name: Courier Laventy
utterances: Busy, busy, busy!  I have to run all of the royal letters across the city, so I don't have time to chat!
Oh!  Hello, I'm glad to see you, <player name>.
Well... only by name, of course.  Now, was there something you needed?
Oh!  Well that's strange, I'm sure I gave it to him.  Well... I have another one right here, it just so happens.  Maybe you can take it to him?
Queen Antonia is wise, and is often prepared ahead of time.  You'll see!  Anyway, here you are.

npcs.name: Crexisz Lepidus
utterances: The Concordium welcomes all seekers of knowledge.

npcs.name: Dalhya Felshire
utterances: You should leave here.  Do not wake the sleeping one.
It is not to protect him.  It is to protect others.  His sleep is not natural, and has proven dangerous to our own colleagues who attempted to discern what was keeping him from waking.

That is correct.  When they fell asleep, their movements and even their breathing seemed to match his.  We were able to move those that slumbered in this way without falling asleep ourselves, but touching Thumore always produces the same result.  I fear he may be beyond aid.

We pondered that possibility, but none have awoken since they fell into the slumber.  It's not worth sacrificing anyone else to attempt to verify that theory, so we can't be certain exactly what it is that's happening.  We theorize that they are entering the same dream that he is in.
You can't be thinking about trying to enter the dream yourself, can you?  We have no idea what is actually happening!  It's possible that we might never be able to wake you again!
That's very true.  But what do you hope to accomplish?  What is it you're going to do once you enter the dream?

Well, I'm not going attempt to talk you out of it any further, if your desire is truly to end up as our other researchers.  Although this might be the only way to help Thumore, I urge you to consider what you're doing.
Thumore? I am sorry, but I do not know any one by that name.

npcs.name: Dalron Pinot
utterances: Hail, and well met! Word has it you're looking for love.
Well, you've come to the right place, my friend... because I am the master at picking up the ladies. Yes, those saucy little minxes go wild for me.
You read my mind! You must have some experience at this sort of thing already, but fear not. My pickup lines are backed by the Pinot Guarantee: Sixty percent of the time… they work every time.

Yes, indeed!  These lines should be all you need to find yourself a little love.  You can start with Brandi Bender, over at the Bank.  I used to date her back in the day, and happen to know she's a bit lonely right now.  Who wouldn't be, after breaking up with a catch such as myself?

npcs.name: Damy Thorn
utterances: Grab an illusion and join the fun!

npcs.name: Dana Ironforge
utterances: Coin is no object when gaining protection from your enemies.  What price can be put on your safety?
I have some nice new suits of chain that have stood up very well.  Would you like to see them?
Well, that suit is looking a mite worn.  Can I interest you in a new suit of fine armor?

npcs.name: Danielle Clothspinner
utterances: Whatever shall I do?  I'm out of dyes, and I simply must finish these yards of cloth today!  I'll certainly never make it all the way across town to get more and still have time to finish with my sewing!
Well, I am always having a problem getting bear pelts of a quality that I can work with and truly make shine.  If you could bring me four preserved bear hides, I can reward you for your efforts.

npcs.name: Darcnir
utterances: Nothing like a good ale with you, that's for sure!

npcs.name: Darion
utterances: We are fortunate indeed to live within the protection of Qeynos' walls.

npcs.name: Delilah Meadowglow
utterances: The blessings of Tunare can be felt all around us, even in this cold land!

npcs.name: Devona Ironforge
utterances: I have nothing else to teach you for the moment.  Please return to me when you have earned enough experience to choose your specialty.
You show interest in the crafting trade.  Good.  We can always use talented artisans.  I can help you get started.  Would you be interested?

There, you now have knowledge required to begin crafting.  Speak to the Tradeskill Tutor for more detailed guidance on learning to craft, if you are interested in more information.  Return to me when you are ready to select a crafting specialty.
I have nothing else to teach you for the moment.  Please return to me when you have earned enough experience to choose your profession.

npcs.name: Disciple Telas'velle
utterances: Well done,  former alum!  You surpassed my greatest expectations in your training.  Now it's time to seek higher wisdom. When you're ready to continue your training, find Missionary Jenson.

npcs.name: Donovan Herald
utterances: Buy today and you'll receive a free litter box!

npcs.name: Drakin Hammerheart
utterances: Ah, greetings!  Now, I hate to seem rude, but I need to ask you not to distract me... I have some thinking to do.
Ah, you are correct!  You must be searching for him as well, then?  Of course you are.  What would the Heroes' Festival be without him here?  Well, the good news is, I've found him!
Well, no.  Not exactly.  It seems that our favorite hero has... well... fallen asleep.

I would, but a few mages appear to be guarding him.  They were quite adamant about not waking him or even touching him.  I have been thinking of a way that maybe I could sneak around them, but they keep thwarting my efforts!
They didn't really say.  I just know they ushered me out before I could say too much.
They're through this door right here.  Be careful, though -- like I said, they don't like people in there.

npcs.name: Drakk
utterances: What I wouldn't give to see Kaladim again.  I'd love to see my grandfather's old shop.

npcs.name: Drappi Oakheart
utterances: Hello there!  If you have any of that old armor from my sweetheart here, I'd be more than happy to offer you some newer stuff!

npcs.name: Drunah Skycaller
utterances: Well met, hero!

npcs.name: Drundo Parn
utterances: Don't bother me, I'm drinking!
Go away! I'm not buying.
Bah! You want to ruin my jolly, ya do!
Fine, fine. Make it quick. I'm getting behind on my ale consumption.
Okay, I think I'm ready for your questions now.
What did you say about my mother?
I don't understand the question.
Thermo-what?
Who?
I don't understand a word you're saying.

npcs.name: Dylan Ironforge
utterances: Nothing's cozier than a nice hot forge!

He did, did he?  I suppose he means to collect on that favor, eh?  Let me see that bone.  Hmm ... I've never worked with bone before, but this is incredibly strong.  Yes ... I can make something out of it.  What would you like?

All right, this shouldn't take long.  A little carving here ... a little shaping there ... and ... voila!  Not too bad for one of my first works of bone, if I do say so myself.  Now Bently can stop bugging me about that favor. HAHA!

npcs.name: Ealoonias
utterances: Has anyone told you about our new retirement savings programs?

npcs.name: Ellinnea Umalia
utterances: You're interrupting my work.

npcs.name: Elspeth Astley
utterances: The winds of time change many things.  One thing remains the same, the might of the sorcerer.
Interesting ... how much are you selling? We can always use more alabaster to make wands.
Perfect. I'll buy all of it.

npcs.name: Emma Healtoe
utterances: Good day to you, <player name>.  What brings you to the Temple of Life?

npcs.name: an entrance guard
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Eoradalanu Otuden
utterances: You must completely devote yourself to the notions of truth and goodness.
As with all conflict, the correct resolution is to not become involved.
Happiness is achieved by those who are kind within and respectful to others.

npcs.name: Eraanus
utterances: Good day to you citizen, all preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Erus Dal'viv
utterances: Ah, hello, <player name>.  I have been waiting for you.

npcs.name: Exalted Milanthroo
utterances: You are fastly becoming the bearer of knowledge and a true master of the arcane!  I have nothing that can continue to challenge someone of your renown and status.

npcs.name: Executor Adept Sal'ynelle
utterances: I'm sorry, until you have chosen a specialty in your craft I do not have any work orders for you.  Come see me when you're more practiced in your trade.

npcs.name: Factor Kai Ferdinand
utterances: The enemies of Qeynos have been squelched due to the selfless acts of your guild! On behalf of Queen Antonia and every citizen of Qeynos, I thank you for everything you all have done.

npcs.name: Feeyord
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.
Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Felion Shadoweater
utterances: Greetings <player name>, what brings you to the Concordium?

npcs.name: Feodra Iceslayer
utterances: Pay no attention to Warley down there he just probably didn't sleep last night and is a little grumpy. Isn't that right Warley?

Warley went to the Tomb of Varsoon to prove he wasn't afraid of walking around on those islands. Sure enough, he didn't get to the first bridge before turning tail and running back home. Poor thing ... all grumpy ... no sleep.

The tomb once held an evil mage - Varsoon the Undying. He was involved in the War of the Plagues centuries ago.  The Cataclysm must have weakened the mage's spells on that place, because he didn't stick around.  The Concordium says that Varsoon is long gone, but you wouldn't catch me dead there!

Heck, I'll tell you where it is! Turn left as you leave the city gates; go through Klicnik Fields. You'll see the islands the tomb rests on.  You go any further ... well, that's your decision, not mine.
Chores you ask? I planned on heading out to the caves to gather some spider venom sacs, but if you're willing and able, I'll let you handle this task. I'll need at least five of the sacs.

npcs.name: Fhara Hanford
utterances: Good day! Welcome to the Ironforge Exchange.
My items are only available for members in good standing with the Ironforge Exchange.

npcs.name: Fidelia Recolo
utterances: I'm sorry.  My services are only available to those more advanced in the arts.

npcs.name: Field Marshal Vishra
utterances: Welcome to Qeynos, my friend.  If you should need assistance, speak with one of our guards, and they should be able to direct you where to go.  Safe travels!
Hail, citizen.  What brings you to this old soldier?
Excellent!  That's one less report to worry over.
There are two other members of the Circle of Ten that have not reported back; General Golias Sydwen and Daylia the Vigil. Could you check in on them, as well?
You'll find General Golias Sydwen at the Qeynos Castle stairs in North Qeynos, and Daylia the Vigil at Arbos in the Elddar Grove.
Hail, <player name>.  Were you able to get the Eye of Bayle and Qeynos Guard reports?
Thank you.  I am certain I will have use of your skills in the future.  You have rather impressed me.
You should speak with Murrar Shar.  He may have something else in mind for you.
Thank you again, <player name>.  Qeynos benefits from heroes like you.

npcs.name: Fillzer Fuzzle
utterances: Not now, I'm looking for treasure!
Hello, hello, did you know sometimes jewels can be found in the most surprising places?
I'll say. I found an amazing gem seventeen years ago. I've been searching for another ever since.
How about you do what you need to do and I keep looking?
Variable dependent on precise temperature differences in the two regions. I'd say correct -0.034% at minimum.
In bolts: uh, twenty-nine over fifty, roughly.
Going to have to abstain.
No idea.
Who?
I think the answer is tension. Did I win? Did I win?
Ooh I hope I win something. That was great fun, thanks.

npcs.name: Flitia Veel
utterances: Hello, traveler!  How I envy you.  What I wouldn't give to journey the world as I did in my youth.   Alas, my days of adventuring are long past, but at least I can occupy myself with my various trinkets and collections that I picked up in my travels.
This is a magnificent find! Here, take this for all your hard work.

Why, any sort of collection. There's so much out there to  find! Just open your eyes and peek under the rocks.  If you find anything interesting, let me have a look. Collecting is the only way I seem to relive my youth!

npcs.name: a forlorn apparition
utterances: Where... is this? Who are you?
I don't... where is this?
Buried? Here? Oh... wait, yes. I remember. There was a... moment. A frightening moment. Or was it... anger? What was I feeling?
Grave? My... grave. My grave isn't here. I'm not... I'm not buried here.
I was driven out. I should be... home? Yes. That's it. I should be home, but something... else... took my place. Drove me here.
I can tell you, but you... you need the key. It is locked.
No... it isn't locked in the way you're thinking. It's... closed. Sealed. You need the key.
I was forced through. I think... I think she was trying to destroy me.
I can find it. It's in a city somewhere. Look for me. I'll seek it out and show you where it is.
Here... here is the key.
Now you'll need to find the mansion.
My... my steed knows the way. I have told her you are coming. She will know, and she... will take you.

npcs.name: Foster Graham
utterances: Come to gaze upon me, have you?
Ahh... my reflection in the water.  How glorious! Nothing is more pleasurable than gazing upon my own beauty.
What!  It cannot be!  Nooooo... Where is my face cream?  My "Erollisi's Bane?"  Have I run out?  Its secret ingredient is rare; the local shops have all been depleted of it.  Alas!

Thank you, friend!  Your plain looks veil a superior heart.  The secret ingredient comes from the gland of the toxic bog slug, which crawls about the local peat bog.  I need several of the toxic glands.
Many thanks, my homely friend.  Take this payment for your service and use it to improve your looks.

npcs.name: Fredrick Losce
utterances: I'm sorry friend. I thought you were someone else.

npcs.name: Friar Montego
utterances: Please give to the Qeynosian Restoration Project, building homes for those who have none.
Alms for the poor... Anyone, anyone?

npcs.name: Fruity
utterances: Hello, traveler! * squawk *

npcs.name: Gandy Gearlotta
utterances: Ahoy hoy, hero!  I hope you are enjoying this celebration.
Why, the fact that another year has come to pass since heroes began to arise to fight for glory and treasure; just as they did in ages long past.
Yes!  Would you like to share the festivities and participate in some of the fun?
The fireworks are my favorite part, as I am sure you can imagine.  Explosions, I tell you, they are good for the soul!
I know!  Take these Ro Candles and place them at the marked spots around North and South Qeynos.  We'll get the entire city celebrating Heroes' Festival in no time!
I saw that last burst of fireworks all the way over here, <player name>.  Good job!
My, my!  Are you looking to light off some more fireworks, <player name>?
I understand that!  I am always in the mood to set some off.  Here you go.  Have fun!

npcs.name: Garion Dunam
utterances: Garion is my name, potions my game.  What can I get for you?
'Bout time this made its way to the alchemist supreme! I was about to complain to the Far Seas. Well, a job done is a job done. Here's your pay. Move along. You're scaring the customers.
Hello, adventurer! Are you looking for a specific potion or ingredient?
There are no refunds for caster error at this shop! Oh ... hello you're not here about a refund.

npcs.name: Garston Viona
utterances: As much as I'd like to help you design a new cloak, the Queen has deemed that only members of more prestigious guilds have access to my services.

npcs.name: Gauldry
utterances: My wares cost more than the cheap goods of the sisters in the other room, but one must pay a price for extravagance, am I right?
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Welcome! What can I help you with?

npcs.name: Gavinfell
utterances: Duty above all else citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Gavin Ironforge
utterances: Welcome to the Call to Arms.

npcs.name: Gemellus Sperasius
utterances: Are you the one with my mechno deliveries?
No I 'spose not.  It has not been long enough for my next package.  I just get so excited by such devices!  Every bit of cog and whir just intrigue this old man somethin' fierce.
What's this?
A gift for me?
Have yourself a happy Frostfell!

npcs.name: General Golias Sydwen
utterances: The Qeynos Guard are a proud legion of fighters dedicated to protecting the city and it's interests.
If you're looking to join the Qeynos Guard, speak with one of our recruitment officers.
Very well then.  I was just about to send a courier with it, but you will do as well as any other.

npcs.name: Gh'lad Tydingz Gigglegibber
utterances: No free moment to say hail, during days of celebration.  So much to do, and so little time!  Much to do.  Yes, yes.
True, true.  Parties and gifts, decorations and food.  No time to gather!
Love it!  Yes, yes!  Gather for me some items that I need for the gifts I am making.  I write them down in your quest journal, and have special treat for you, when done.
Yay!  You good and brought items back for me to make more gifts.  You so good!  Now you take this as holiday treat for work done.
I can use more help if you got the time, or friend G'shugahplum may need a hand with his gifts, too.
You bring back the items I need, then I will be of making more gifts.  Hurry!

npcs.name: a Gigglegibber Illusionist
utterances: More nights should be dead ones, like these!
Creepy ghoulies walk the streets!
Happy, happy Nights of the Dead to you!  You should join us and wander streets like creepy crawlies!
Smells my feet!  Smells my feet!

npcs.name: Gigglegibber Scalper
utterances: Boo! I got some great tickets here to the Haunted House. You should try it out!
Want a ticket?  It'll only cost you 5 silver!

Usually, I charge 5 silver... But you's look like an upstanding sort, so I'll give ya a chance to go in there for free this one time. You just remember that I's did this and you come back to me for all your Nights of the Dead needs.
You survived! Good job... You done real good. Here is your prize, come again.
Back for more, eh? Like ta be scared I'm guessing...
It's a Haunted House. There is scary haunty stuff in there, spiders and dirt and, and...
Want a ticket into the Haunted House? They're cheap...

npcs.name: Gimit Delerg
utterances: Oy there! *hic* Come ere' and have a drink wiff me. *hic* I promish I don't bite.
Oy! I'll leave when I am good and ready. *hic* And no little pansy is going to stop me.
I'd like to see ya try. *hic*
Aye, I hear ya! *hic* We'll take it outside then. *hic* I'll teach ya not get between a dwarf and his drink.
I've marked the spot on the map. *hic* I'll be there as soon as I finish this drink. *hic* "Ladies" first.
I'll show ya to mess wiff me and mai drink! *hic*
Alright! I give, I'll go back to work... Just let me lay on the ground for a while...

npcs.name: Grabby Gigglegibber
utterances: If you gets treats off creepy crawly or undead beasties, do let me know!
I be trading all Nights of Dead treats for my candy corns.  Yucksy corn.
I gives you candy corns for any treats you have found.  One stack of corns much easier to carry!
Yay!  You wanna trade me one of your Nights of Dead treats for one candy corn?  One type of candy be much easier stack in your bags.
So much treats you carry!  I be trading all them for my candy corns.  Yucksy corn.
Yay!  You wanna trade me five of your Nights of Dead treats for five candy corns?  One type of candy be much easier stack in your bags.

npcs.name: Gracen Docks
utterances: You should watch the sky at night sometime, it sure does get pretty.
Sometimes fate leaves you guessing, but never forget that the point is buried in there somewhere.

npcs.name: Grandmaster Kimbialis
utterances: If you wish to learn about crafting, speak to the tradeskill tutorial trainer.
Come see me later, I may have some work for you once you're more skilled in your trade.

npcs.name: Gray Magnificent
utterances: I hope you enjoyed the performance!

npcs.name: Greldane Irongut
utterances: What do you mean ye drank more than I did?
I could use another ale for the road anytime now.
I could use another ale over here. My stein is more than half empty.
My stein hasn't any legs to walk over and fill itself up.

npcs.name: Gretin
utterances: Qeynos is nice but... it's too open, don't you think?

npcs.name: Gretta Steinbeard
utterances: Greetings, traveler!  My tavern's warm, and the company's good.

npcs.name: G'shugahplum Gigglegibber
utterances: Must hurries for the gifties!
I gives them fur bustle or copper socks.  What you think?
Shiny bits to share!  Help mes be gifty.  You feel warm-good when kaput the job.
Gifties not so done, but mes needs names of peoples to give pretties to.
Mes know who to give bits to, but names hard to pull out of head.  You find peoples' names.
Mes described in your quest journal whos to be gifted.  Talks with them 'n return to mes.
Yous find names for gifties?
Goody, goody!  Names on tags.  Bits of precious is ready for yours delivery now!  You take these gifties to the right people and you gets one of your own!
Yous got room in pockets for 6 gifties?
Here, here.  These to give!  Quick, quick!
No!  No!  What you do?  Gettin' perfect gifties hurt me head, but yous go and waste all.
Gifties good when they go to right friend.  Gifties now wasted.  You gave to wrong gifters.
Yay!  Yay!  Yous do good.  Yous Frostfell tree is now besparkled!
Sparkled!  Yous can make it shine, and twinkle.  Fun, fun!  Happy Frostfell!
Merry Frostfell to one and all!

npcs.name: Gutten Gigglegibber
utterances: Happy Frostfell for you!  Yes, yes!  You wants one of Gutten's special holiday trees.
Yes!  Course you do!  You no chop or bought such trees anywhere like Gutten's.
You want frosty Frostfell tree!
This Gigglegibber make happy to deal make with you!  Frostfell days of happy time and sharing happy smiles with others.  You share happy with others in city.
Perfect good!  You put up sparklies, color bright bits, in the city!
Yes, yes!  You grab the badger by the tail!  Decorate the city dark areas.  I gives you sparklies and you puts them  in blah spots.
You knows where to puts the sparklies, 'cuz them blah spots be marked by other Gigglegibbers.
I has happy mouth to see you again, <player name>!  You done sparklies spreadin'?
Hmm.  Something's wrong.  I sees it!  What not go right?

Eeks and yipes!  That 'splains why sparklies never stuck there.  Why that grump-bump no like them, I'll never knows.  But you done good and should be getting frosty tree.  Take tree ticket and pick up the besparkled frosty tree!
Happy Frostfell!
Clicks on the sparkly frosty tree standing nexts to me.  Then you gets Frosty Frostfell Tree!
I heard if yous help McScroogle with his Frostfell Favor, then the tree has more decorations.

npcs.name: Gyles
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Haint
utterances: Make yourself some creepy armor, or decorations for your crypt!
I've got your Nights of the Dead crafting goods!

store.gamelink: \aITEM 1561738651 1119525384:Nights of the Dead Dshinn Pygmy Costume\/a

npcs.name: Hal
utterances: Welcome to the Ironforge Exchange.
Please let me know if there's anything I can supply for you.
I'll be happy to supply all your fuel needs.

npcs.name: Harold Dunstan
utterances: Hail traveler.  Can I offer you a drink to quench your thirst?

npcs.name: Hegrenn
utterances: Greetings, traveler!  If you need home furnishings, you came to the right place.
Welcome to our house of furnishings, friend. Anything an adventurer desires is found within these walls!
Hello there, fine adventurer!  Do you see anything that would make your stay in the city more comfortable?
Please look at our wonderful selection!  We carry everything that a discerning adventurer needs.

npcs.name: a Heroes' Festival celebrator
utterances: Come, and celebrate our heroes, whether they be in the Ethernere or upon Norrath!
You should speak with Dalhya Felshire and take part in more of the festivities!
This truly is the Age of Destiny!
It's hard to believe that another year of adventuring has gone by.
Raise a pint for the heroes who have come before you!
These are some amazing times we are living in, to be sure!

npcs.name: Human Tradeskill Apprentice
utterances: Hello there!  I notice an air of mastery around you.  Are you an experienced tradesman?

npcs.name: Indis Surion
utterances: Search for the relics of the past Age of Turmoil.  Their discovery will gain you great power and prestige!

store.gamelink: \aITEM -1189754200 -375196521 0 0 0:"Bird Watching - The Do's and Don'ts of Nektulos Forest"\/a
\aITEM 402888126 1542454296 0 0 0:Assistant Researcher's Notes, Vol. 1, Halls of Erudin\/a
\aITEM -2130000892 2020703998 0 0 0:Assistant Researcher's Notes, Vol. 2, The High Council of Erudin\/a
\aITEM -166857582 -78339550 0 0 0:Assistant Researcher's Notes, Vol. 3, The High Council of Erudin\/a
