\aITEM 1690892980 1596687542 0 0 0:Karath Smoothmane - The Breaking of the Pact\/a
\aITEM -997544670 356461536 0 0 0:The Far Side of Tears, Part Four\/a
\aITEM -1910642579 765721760 0 0 0:The Far Side of Tears, Part One\/a
\aITEM -1595162389 -359556192 0 0 0:The Far Side of Tears, Part Three\/a
\aITEM -1215245144 -1775512960 0 0 0:The Far Side of Tears, Part Two\/a
\aITEM 1901491052 1623131519 0 0 0:The Minions of the Mighty Creature Catalog\/a
\aITEM 1503957005 459978822 0 0 0:The Missing Pages of the Sword Heist Journal - Rebound\/a

npcs.name: Inquisitor Loffren
utterances: So ye want to learn o' the battle clerics o‘ Brell, do ye?  Ye've come to tha right coldain.

Aye.  Tha coldain have been fightin' them blasted Ry'Gorr orcs since before me granpa's first whisker!  Now we coldain have always had the numbers against us.  Blasted orcs breed like tha vermin they be.
I'ma gittin' to that!  When yer always outnumbered, everyone needs ta be fightin'.  Ye won't be findin' any self-respectin' coldain hidin' behind his friends' beards when orcs come a'callin'.
So the coldain battle clerics are on the front lines!  We be helpin' enemies of our clans meet their gods in person, and remindin' our own clanmates tha' Brell be fightin' wit' us.
Some o' tha new arrivals ta New Halas have been expressin' some concerns ‘bout the more "hands on" approach we have, in comparison to the more "traditional" roles of the templars.
Well, thar be none tha' would say the gods want their children to just lay down ‘n die when faced wit' danger.  Even the monks of Quellious know when it be time to show an enemy tha floor!

We coldain have endured much worse for a lot longer than most, is all. Tha style be different, but tha praises to tha gods be the same. If a fellow coldain needs ta hear tha stories o' Brell, but they be always on the field o' battle, then that's wheres I need ta do my preaching, if they're to hear me.

Aye.  Those that be wantin' ta learn, that is. Yer High Council saw tha wisdom in havin' others learn tha skills we battle clerics bring. Times ain't gettin' any easier, and the front line o' battle be the place where the faithful need the most guidance.

npcs.name: an Ironforge smith
utterances: The Ironforge Exchange constructed, brewed, tailored, forged, baked, or scribed just about everything you see here in Qeynos.
The Tunarian Alliance refuses to acknowledge that a balance can be found between the growing needs of our citizenry and the desire to preserve the woodlands.
The Concordium are so consumed by their ancient tomes and dead languages that they fail to see the world right before their own noses.
Contrary to the preachings of the Celestial Watch there is fulfillment to be found in labor and the fruits thereof.

npcs.name: an Ironforge trader
utterances: The Ironforge Exchange constructed, brewed, tailored, forged, baked, or scribed just about everything you see here in Qeynos.
The Tunarian Alliance refuses to acknowledge that a balance can be found between the growing needs of our citizenry and the desire to preserve the woodlands.

npcs.name: Jason Merrytoe
utterances: You can find harvests for making level 1-9 items in areas where level 1-9 adventurers go to hunt.
Hello, friend!  I'm here to teach interested people a little bit about how to harvest crafting materials, and how to craft tradeskilled items.  Are you interested?

npcs.name: Jason Walton
utterances: Greetings, what can I help you with today?
Welcome to the South Qeynos branch of the Norrath Exchange!

npcs.name: Jayson V'rhees
utterances: The ghouls that walk the city on this night are of no threat.
Grab an illusion and join the fun!

npcs.name: Jo Ironshield
utterances: Can I help you?

npcs.name: Joren Kalth
utterances: Can I help you?
Hello! You look like a capable adventurer, come speak with me!
A hero in our very presence!
Of course, yes... The New Combine has pushed into Cobalt Scar, but the Awakened have dug in deep. We're here requisitioning new supplies, but you... you could be the fulcrum this battle hinges on.

Dire is a good word for it. We're fraying at the edges, and the Awakened have seemingly endless numbers. Kerafyrm has played his hand well. We need someone who can match his cunning. I think that's you.

Go to Cobalt Scar. Find the Supply Camp at Salt Breeze. Your presence alone should be enough to inspire the rank and file. There are some things that only a legend such as yourself can do, and they'll need your power.

npcs.name: Jowling
utterances: Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!
Welcome! What can I help you with?
Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!

npcs.name: Junayda Kader
utterances: As you wish, sir.
Does the art of illusions produce such an effect?
He's rather graceful, is he not?
Size doesn't seem to matter much does it?

npcs.name: Katlyn Paisley
utterances: Hello, adventurer! Are you looking for a specific potion or ingredient?
There are no refunds for caster error at this shop! Oh ... hello you're not here about a refund.
Are you wounded?  I just made up a fresh batch of healing potions an hour ago.
What happened to the highly explosive bottle that was on my desk?  Have you seen it?

npcs.name: Kayben Eatny
utterances: You're slower than usual today. Have you been slippin yourself more than a few drinks under the table?
I can't tell this pub from a pigsty.  Get to work and clean this mess!
Hey! No fighting in my pub. Take it outside!

npcs.name: Khalil'mun
utterances: Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!
Welcome! What can I help you with?
Come in!  Come in!  A mage's greeting to you, my friend!  And now, what can I mix for you?  A potion?  A salve, perhaps?  Ahhh ... I know; you need alchemical supplies, don't you?

npcs.name: Khayrat Batul
utterances: Apprentice, you may begin.
You see how the subject's will melts away?
Who said ogres couldn't dance?

Long ago the art of enchanting combined the separate disciplines of illusion and coercion.  Now with the aid of Malevini Darlyner, the Concordium is able to bring these two sibling schools together again.
Why go to the theater to see such a fine performance?

npcs.name: Kiriana Northsky
utterances: What brings you to the Temple of Life, <player name>?

npcs.name: Knight-Lieutenant Laughlin
utterances: Hail and well met!  Please be aware that while you are safe within Qeynos' mighty walls, the outside world is not as forgiving. Dangerous creatures roam the lands beyond these gates.  Beware!

Famous, eh?  Best keep your feet planted before your head floats off.  Though, if you're looking for some recognition, I've been having some problems with the gnolls outside the gates here.  I can't spare the men to go hunt them down, you wouldn't be interested in helping out, would you?

Such an eager recruit! Bring me back the ears of ten gnolls.  That should be sufficient to bring their population down to a reasonable level for now.  You'll find them around the gates of the city, roaming like the dogs they are!

So you did... so you did.  Well met adventurer you may be famous one day after all.  Let me see, I think the city can afford to pay you a bit for your work here.  Take this bag of coins, it should suffice.

npcs.name: Knight Guardian Bestrom
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Knight Guardian MacMurris
utterances: I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.
Duty above all else citizen, except honor!
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Knight-Guard Rellin'thir
utterances: Your guild is very well-disciplined. We can't thank you enough for all of the help you've given us.  You need to speak to Sergeant Ironcast.  He'll have all your guild's writs from now on.  Congratulations on your promotion!

npcs.name: Krelal
utterances: Duty above all else citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Kwipp Stalwart
utterances: Greetings and salutations!
You there!  My brave friend, you're the hero that I've been looking for!
I was given an account of your heroic deeds by a colleague within the Circle of Ten.
You must have been unaware of it.  Harkam Nubbytoe and Baron Kaedrin Ironforge are members of the Circle, as am I.
It is imperative that we keep Queen Antonia informed of the events within Qeynos.  I was hoping you would go forth and collect updates from others, so I can build a comprehensive report.
Marvelous!  Here's a list of the frogloks that I need updates from and where they are located.
Salutations, <player name>!  What news do you carry back from my brethren?
And Foorog Gallantblade?
And what of my mate, Kwa?
He was?!  How is he?  What happened?
Oh, that is such a relief, <player name>.  Marr bless you!  I will be sure to include each to make my report as thorough as possible.  Thank you!
May I request another task, brave <player name>?
Vishra, the Queen's most trusted guard and military commander, should be given my comprehensive report of the troubles within Qeynos.  He will ensure that it is delivered to Queen Antonia.
Excellent!  Field Marshal Vishra can be found at the The Sovereign House of Qeynos within Qeynos Capitol District.

npcs.name: Kyle Antihilus Bayle
utterances: Citizens! The might of the Bayle line guides me!
In the dark times we see ahead, only I can bring you triumphs as my ancestors did.
My knowledge of the foul pretenders, our enemies Lucan D`Lere and Drinal, is needed for us to prevail.
It is not luck that I have returned now, the firstborn son of Antonius Bayle III, to take my rightful place on the throne.
I laid down my life to be reborn to serve and save you from ruin.
I suffer in this immortal form for you willingly, my fellow people of Qeynos. I've come to lead you out of the darkness and into the light of victory.
You are soft in the hands of Antonia. Discipline is weak amongst you.
Uniting with the scourge of Freeport is unforgiveable. We must fortify our walls and protect who and what we are.
No more will your pride be tarnished by an alignment with evil.
With the throne, I vow to strengthen you as I have so many others.
You will become unshakeable and undefeated as all Bayles before me.
No compromise.
No failure.
Only victory and dominion over Norrath.
We shall see, false Queen.

npcs.name: Lady Rickson
utterances: The gnolls that patrol Antonica may yet surprise us with their strength; many Antonicans believe them all but defeated, they will use that belief to their advantage.
This city is beautiful, even in ill weather.
The Claymore is elegant yet deadly; it is a perfect icon for Qeynos.

npcs.name: Lakosha Maera
utterances: It is a pleasure, citizen.

npcs.name: Laura Ironforge
utterances: Hello and welcome to the city.  Everything you need can be found here in Qeynos.
Hail, good traveler!
Greetings traveler and welcome to our village. Be sure to help us keep it tidy.
Hail to you as well, traveler.  There is much work to be done in Qeynos, might as well get started on it now.
You stand within the sturdy and unyielding walls of Qeynos, give thanks for their existence!

npcs.name: Leona Ward
utterances: Welcome, traveler. Welcome to my shop.  Please, take a look around!

npcs.name: Librarian Dalmas
utterances: Please be quiet when inside this place.
You do not look like as if you spend much time in libraries, but please browse around as you like, and close the door firmly when you leave.

Ahh, what is this?  A very famous explorer, Hasten Bootstrutter, wrote this book.  This is a rare and valuable treasure, indeed.  Thank you, good adventurer, for returning it to us.  Our library will cherish it.  Please accept this rare item as a token of our gratitude.

npcs.name: Librarian Dungil
utterances: Please be quick, I am very busy.

npcs.name: Librarian Galdin
utterances: Welcome to the library.  If you have any questions, feel free to ask.

npcs.name: Lieutenant Erwin
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Lil' Boo
utterances: Make yourself some creepy armor, or decorations for your crypt!

npcs.name: Lillita Softpaws
utterances: Hello therrre. Arrrre you enjoying the festivities? If so, perrrhaps you could help me with a little prrroblem.
Well, you see. I decorrrated the north and south of Qeynos with lovely colorrrful lanterrrns. Howeverrr, they have been disappearrring left and rrright.

I followed the trrracks left behind and found that gnolls frrrom Antonica, just outside our city gates, have snuck in thrrrough the sewerrr systems and have been stealing the decorrrations. I can't tell if it is out of jealousy or what, but I need yourrr help getting the decorrrations back. Will you help me?
I see the twinkle of lights in the distance. How prrretty. Werrre you able to place them all?
Well I thank you. I can enjoy the festivities once again now that the city is twinkling once more. I hope you enjoy them as well.
Hello again. I'm sorry to say, but those darrrn gnolls have stolen the decorrrations again. Could you help get them back, please?

npcs.name: Lilly Ironforge
utterances: You're sure to find something dazzling within our jewelery cases.

npcs.name: Local patron
utterances: I am trying to concentrate here. Talk to me later!
Have you any spare foozlebits?  Don't you hate being one foozlebit short of a fwinger?
A hard day of adventuring makes one long for home, don't it?
Ah, what I wouldn't give to cradle a mug of good Dwarven Ale just now.
Treasures from the past can be found throughout the lands, for those who care to look.
I'm not used to this weather, but my people can adapt to any change in order to survive.

npcs.name: Londiar Inygad
utterances: Hello there!  Would you perhaps be able to assist us with some Tinkering, Transmuting, or Adorning tasks?

Thank you, we are always in need of thingamajigs.  Please take this recipe and these components, and get to work.  You will need to supply your own fuel, however, and the cost of this will not be reimbursed.

I can teach you the basics, however you will want to visit the tinkering trainer on the docks of Butcherblock Mountains to learn more recipes.  While you're there, you can also learn more about adorning if you are interested.
Glad to hear it <player name>! Please take this recipe and these components, and get to work.  You will need to supply your own fuel, however, and the cost of this will not be reimbursed.
Good day, friend.  Let me know if you take up the craft of adorning, I may have some work for you if so.

I will teach you the basics, however you will want to visit the adorning trainer on the docks of Butcherblock Mountains to learn more recipes.  While you're there, you can also learn more about tinkering if you are interested.
That's great <player name>! Please take this recipe and these components, and get to work.  You will need to supply your own fuel, however, and the cost of this will not be reimbursed.
Fantastic, it should just take a moment to transmute these discarded guard boots?
Well, get on with it then, no time like the present!

npcs.name: Lothaire Stormgazer
utterances: Hip hip hooray! Hip hip haroo! Celebrate the heroes; they've saved me and you!
Most people don't know... can't know how many times their lives have been saved by the great heroes of Norrath. No doubt, they'd be driven mad or at least have a crisis of significance.

Sure, and there are songs of great deeds, and great tales told by the bards and loreists, all extolling the virtues of the heroes. That's why all these people are celebrating, of course, but do they really know?
Aye. They couldn't possibly know all that's been sacrificed for everyone's lives and afterlife!
Yes! I was there. I was one of the souls who had been taken before their time, and who had been returned due to the actions of the great heroes.
I still dream of it, you know? My memories of Ethernere are still so vivid. Would you like to see it?

Share with you my memories? The mysteries of this world continue to astound, don't they? I simply ask that while you are there, that you do something I was not able to at the time; obtain several swatches of cryosilk.
Enter my memory of Fear in Ethernere. Don't forget the swatches of cryosilk.

npcs.name: Lysndra
utterances: I do not need any help, adventurer.
Sorry, thought you were another lookin' for work.  Nothin' gets under my fur more than when people treat me like I can't provide for myself.  This girl's doin' it for herself!
Truth be told, I prefer it that way.  I never have known what to do with myself unless I'm active.  Even my hobbies keep my paws busy!

npcs.name: Maareona Ludimintium
utterances: I suppose I appreciate your interest in speaking with me, but I am here as a service to those of my own kind.

npcs.name: Maege Blackwing
utterances: Greetings traveler, have you come seeking enlightenment into the path of transmuting and adorning?
I'm glad others are interested in following the path.  This is a long and difficult path, however, and may not be cheap or easy to pursue.

The items you will need to work with are created by using your Transmuting skill to break down regular items into their essential components.  You will learn the skill of Adorning to convert these components into new, powerful Adornments that can enhance your armor.

I have given you some starting knowledge into the making of Adornments.  You may use your Transmuting skill to divulge the true essences of rare artifacts found throughout the lands and break them down to simpler forms; you may then use these components to create powerful Adornments.  Speak to a trainer or seek rare recipes throughout the lands to gain Adornment recipes.

npcs.name: Mage Fulcrum Gearshift
utterances: The Concordium is always looking for mysterious arcane items.

npcs.name: Magrah Flintglimmer
utterances: Brell be expectin' his priests ta be fighters as well as shepherds, and Brell take any wolf that comes near me flock!
Oi, this city certainly be a colorful place! Who'da ‘magined such a thin'?

npcs.name: Magus Weskah
utterances: Is there something I can help you with?

npcs.name: Maile
utterances: Oh, hello! I'm sorry, was I helping you with something?
Please just let me know if there's something you'd like to buy.

npcs.name: Marik McPherson III
utterances: Gods bless Qeynos!

npcs.name: Marjorie Falconius
utterances: Oh, hello there!  What can I do for you?
Ah, I should have been expecting this.  Erollisi Day comes 'round and love is in the air, thick as my cinnamon hard bread!  Mmmmm!
I do!  It gives me a great excuse to bake frilly desserts and pastries.  Not that I need much reason, mind you!  I love cookin' and watching others enjoy my creations.
It's my trade and my hobby!  I take a lot of pride in my culinary skills.

npcs.name: Medic Brendan
utterances: May the light of the Prime Healer guide you.  My spells and religious symbols will aid you in your quest to further the cause of good. Please, come closer, adventurer.
Another capacity?  Well, we do need help gathering components for our potions. We supply the guards with an antidote in case something poisonous attacks them on their rounds.
Splendid! Now, pay close attention. We need the venom sacs of white spiders and albino cave snakes. I'll write down in your journal the amount we need and where you can find them.

npcs.name: Medic Rowena
utterances: Rodcet's blessings upon you. How may the Temple of Life assist you today?

npcs.name: Melinnae Welxen
utterances: There is much lost knowledge hidden within the library here.

npcs.name: Melony Danyells
utterances: I've got a treat for ya!  Ha!  Ha!  Ha!

npcs.name: Meyer
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: a militia guard
utterances: His lordship, Kyle Antihilius Bayle will now speak to the public!

npcs.name: Milton
utterances: I hate the night shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.
Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Milupet Cogsory
utterances: Oh, my apologies.  I didn't see you come up.  I don't mean to be rude!
Oh, you haven't heard?  Thumore D'armer was supposed to join us for the Heroes' Festival, but no one has heard from him since it started.  We're getting a little worried...

You can't be serious!  Thumore D'armer is one of the greatest heroes of our time!  He was among the first who came here, and has done it all since his arrival.  There's no place on Norrath he hasn't explored, no monster he hasn't defeated, no treasure he hasn't collected.  He is what all adventurers should aspire to be!

I am sure that he is here somewhere, because I saw him not too long ago.  I am just not certain where he might have gone since then.  A friend of mine, Drakin, said that he would go find him, but hasn't returned.  I wonder what he found.

Oh, would you mind?  That would be perfect, I think.  See if you can find Drakin, and see what he might know about Thumore's whereabouts.  I doubt they would be far... I would check the buildings near here.  Thanks again for your help!

npcs.name: Mirf Guinders
utterances: Search within your soul! Reclaim your faith! Bristlebane lives within us. Do not abandon his mirth! We are not forsaken!

Ah, yes, the key. Unfortunately the key was swiped from my pack by a wretched being called the Rat Queen, wrangler of rodents. Find her and you find your key. Then you can follow my notes to the Sepulcher of Jahnda.
The Sepulcher of Jahnda? I know of it. I happened to discover its location when I was in a part of the catacombs the locals call Vermin's Snye.
When the temple of Mirf Guinders has a donation of jade golem crystals then I will offer you directions to the Sepulcher of Jahnda.
Good adventurer, have faith and be well!  Perhaps one day you too may serve Bristlebane!

npcs.name: Missionary Jenson
utterances: Welcome back. You've grown so much since we first met.  Partisan Keladerouo requests the assistance of your guild--when you feel the time is right.  Goodbye, my friend.
We must always temper justice with mercy and forgiveness.

npcs.name: Morly Tinswaddle
utterances: Greetings. I have the honor of being one of the first master tinkerers in a long time.  As you may know, tinkering is the process created by gnomes many centuries ago.  It was used to make the clockworks that served in the great city of Ak'Anon, as well as many devices that were used every day by tinkerers of old.

I am so happy that you asked. As part of my duties as a master tinkerer, I also train people in the basics of the craft.  I can teach you the skills that you will use, and start you on the path to clockwork glory!
You're sure that you'd like to learn the secondary path of Tinkering?

You now have the most rudimentary knowledge in tinkering.  You may now start learning to craft Gadgets, Gizmos, and Doohickeys of your own.  Please speak to the tinkering merchant to pick up your blueprints.
You've yet to become a crafter.  Please return once you've learned some crafting and I'll teach you more.

npcs.name: Mott
utterances: I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now I may die of boredom.
Good day to you citizen, all preserve Queen Antonia.
Duty above all else citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Musheff af'Neqi
utterances: ... which would put their disappearance sometime in the Elder Age... oh, I'm sorry.  Was there something you needed?
Indeed it is, and is fraught with INTERRUPTIONS.  But since I can't get to my study any more, this is as good of a place as any.
Because of the turmoil in Starcrest Commune.  It's not a safe place for anyone at the moment.  Come to think of it, I'm not sure any of the smaller neighborhoods are in very good shape right now.

Where have you been?  The rumors are all over.  Whispers of gnolls in the Willow Wood, of dimensional portals in the Baubbleshire, of madness in Graystone Yard... and those are just a few.  For all of its 'peace' and 'liberty', Qeynos is a rather hard place to live right now.

Oh, I'm not certain.  I just want the Queen to take care of it.  I know there's a lot to worry about for her right now, but we need her to focus on the city and its troubles.  If she doesn't, she might see people packing up and leaving for somewhere they feel is safer.

npcs.name: Myra Fizzleboom
utterances: You look like you need help.  Can I help you find something?
We've all the basic supplies that you'll ever need.  Are you looking for anything specific?

npcs.name: Neezer Grund
utterances: Quickly now, don't think about halflings!

You thought about halflings when I said that, didn't you? It's a new technique I'm working on to help gather data about people. Raw data, nothing but the foremost thoughts on the brain. That's why it's got to be quick.
Oh it works wonderfully! I bet you're still thinking about halflings. You seem interested, how would you like to help me collect some data?

Great! Go and ask all of the questions to Drundo at Irontoes East, Remo, who I think may be out by the Claymore Plaza, and Fillzer, who's probably panning for gold somewhere along the aqueduct. Keep in mind, the answers aren't the only important things to note here.

Sorry, here they are. Ask the questions rapidly once you start, keep their answers fresh. Also, and this is also very important, you must write down the very first word in their answer. With that information I will be able to determine what is on their mind specifically, and whether or not they're actually understanding the question.
Strange but probably not surprising. Now get started!
Did you gather the information?

Okay. I'm all set up to record the data but I need you to give it to me in a specific fashion. I'll say "question one" and you'll give me Drundo's answer, then Remo's answer, then Fillzer's answer. Do you understand?
Okay. Question one.
All right. Question two.
Question three.
All right. Question four.
Thermawatt?! I can't believe Drundo knew that one! Okay, question five.
Ouch. Okay, question six.
A tautology! Interesting! So my answers are: erm leave variable what the in I nut going Thermawatt I no who who who I is I. Wow, this is exciting stuff!
This is going to take me a long time to decipher. I may never figure it out! Sorry, I'm a bit excited. Listen, while I take care of this...HALFLINGS!
That's what I thought!

npcs.name: a Nettleville resident
utterances: I am so sad about all this, I trust them.
I don't know what to make of all this chaos, leave me be.
I don't know what I can do to help.

npcs.name: Noelle Dering
utterances: Greetings! I welcome you to Irontoes East! Please speak with Harold or Gretta if you need help!

npcs.name: Nonnie Runtuftle
utterances: You look a bit weary, child.  Have you traveled long?
Well, I have always found that the length of road hardly matters.  It is the drudgery of the road that tires ya out!

You must learn 'ta appreciate the little things along the way!  A beautiful sunset, or the light through the trees.  Myself, I have a collection of beetles.  Maybe a bit odd, but so very pretty, each one of 'em.  Somethin' like that may help you along and bring a new spring to ya step.
Back again, child?
My, my!  Thank you.
Happy Frostfell to you!

npcs.name: an onlooking citizen
utterances: Look! It is Queen Antonia Bayle!

npcs.name: Othmir Tradeskill Apprentice
utterances: Hello there!  I notice an air of mastery around you.  Are you an experienced tradesman?

npcs.name: a pacified Qeynos resident
utterances: May the gods continue to bless us.
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Qeynos can't accomplish!
We must not doubt Queen Antonia. We owe much to her leadership!
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
I know there are those who wish harm upon Qeynos, but I just feel sorry for them.
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Qeynos still stands.

npcs.name: Partisan Keladerouo
utterances: Well done, my pupil. You have entered our ranks and saved the city from countless dangers.  Not only do I thank you, but the Queen herself wishes to extend her gratitude to your guild.  Only the purest of missions will do for you and I have none left that would pose a challenge.
Welcome to the sanctuary of the Temple of Life.  Always let your inner strength burn brightly against the forces of evil.

npcs.name: a party crashing gnoll
utterances: We will ruin your festival.
Back off!
We will not stop until we spoil your celebrations.
I'll bite you!

npcs.name: Patricia
utterances: Sorry, I can't visit right now.  Too much work to do around the Ironforge estate.

npcs.name: Patricia Benson
utterances: The humans of this city have always had a hand in its survival and they will continue to protect its walls.
Hello, I don't suppose you would be interested in some humanitarian work would you?

Yes, we humans have always been a referee of sorts when it comes to different racial tensions within Qeynos. Some races have problems with each other that stems from something someone did many seasons ago. If we are to continue to survive as a city we will need these races to pull together and put aside their differences.

Great! That is the attitude I love to see from fellow humans. We need to start with the kerrans and Erudites. They have been at odds for a long time but they are working together right now to handle an issue going on in Starcrest Commune.
Yes. They are showing they can work together when they need to. We should try to strengthen that and push them to continue to work together once this current crisis has passed.

Go to Starcrest Commune and talk with any Kerrans or Erudites you see actively taking a role in leading the current defense. We can hope that once this blows over they will continue to be a leader if not physically then emotionally.

npcs.name: Pendair
utterances: Hello!  Such a mischievous day, is it not?

npcs.name: Penny Goodhearth
utterances: Thanks to the Copperpots, now I have more time to finish preparing Lord and Lady Ironforge's supper!

npcs.name: Peona Toughins
utterances: Dare I say, it's a fine day for shopping. How can I help you?
Hello there!  Can I interest you in some of the finest merchandise this side of Norrath?

npcs.name: Popelia
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Preceptor Gabbro
utterances: Careful thar. This young one still be learnin' ta hit ‘is target.
By Brell it be hot ‘round here!  Would ye be knowin' a place nearby that would have a mug or two for a thirsty coldain?
Surely ye don't think tha' Brell means for me ta stand in tha' back whilst me friends have all the fun, do ye?

npcs.name: Prelate Lorhym Ithpsym
utterances: Fate smiles upon thee. The Celestial Watch is most thankful for all that your guild has done to protect this city. Our most benevolent Queen, Antonia, has also heard of your accomplishments and has asked me to extend a most heartfelt expression of gratitude. Go now with the blessing of this temple and continue in your path to righteousness.
Welcome to the sanctuary of the Temple of Life.  Always let your inner strength burn brightly against the forces of evil.

npcs.name: Priestess Allora Reed
utterances: Rodcet's blessing be upon you.  I am a priestess of this temple.  As you can see, though the gods have left Norrath, our faith sustains us and strengthens our resolve.  When the Prime Healer returns to us, it shall be a glorious day indeed!

npcs.name: Priestess Avarona Wenhaver
utterances: Hail, <player name>.  If it is solace you desire, you will find it within these walls.

npcs.name: Priest Ian Turner
utterances: Raise not your hand in judgment of others, for one day they may be your salvation.
You disturbed a burial chamber?  What right do you have to commit such an atrocity? How could you violate someone in death?  Speak, before I truly lose my temper!
In that case, I apologize.  Disturbing the sanctity of a grave is one of the few things that I feel reaches the depths of depravity.  Let me have a look, and I'll see what I can find for you.

This doesn't look like a used burial shroud.  It's far too clean.  Unless ... no, the undead cannot venture there ... can they? Quickly, take this shroud back to the catacombs, and return it to the position above the tomb whence it came.  Take this box with you, and it will open when you replace the shroud.

The site you seek is  the tomb of Lord Mrallon. Many times he valiantly proved his worth to the city of Qeynos. You will search for the knight with the green armor and place this shroud over the likeness of his body.
What is wrong, adventurous one?  Why so out of breath?
Fear not.  And catch your breath.  Wounded from what?
Ah!  Then you will require the Superior Salve of Nife.  I can provide this for you, but I don't have all of the items here.
Gladly.  You'll find grove lily pads within Elddar Grove, crystal vials within South Qeynos, and harbor pinchers within Qeynos Harbor.

There is another component that is required, but time is of the essence.  I will get it myself, while you gather the others.  Meet me at the northeastern corner of Elddar Grove when you have acquired all on your list.

npcs.name: Priscilla Stoneguard
utterances: Well met friend!

npcs.name: Prophet Bainyn Fairwind
utterances: Hail Adventurer! Do you come seeking that which only Rodcet Nife can provide?
The Prime Healer welcomes all who wish to follow his ways. The ways of bringing good health to all of Norrath can be found through him and him alone.

The Prime Healer has many enemies who wish to bring Plague and undeath to these lands. Do you pledge yourself against such antagonists? Do you have the courage in your heart to stand up to beasts so foul they can make your stomach turn?

Very well, but one does not just become a servant of health. You must prove your worth against the powers of Death and Disease to gain favor with Rodcet Nife himself. Only then will you be worthy of being such an agent.

Rodcet Nife has two major enemies, however one we need not worry about as she has long since departed this plane. The other is The God of Disease and Decay, Bertoxxulous. He is a vile god, and relishes the thought of this world being overrun by diseases, natural and unnatural alike.

Rodcet has come to know and trust a few other gods that share similar visions of how this world should be. Such allies are Prexus, the Ocean Lord who was the creator of the ancient race known as the Kedge, Quellious the Tranquil known for her peaceful nature, as well as sister to Mithaniel Marr, Erollisi Marr the Goddess of Love who we are actually a bit unsure about her whereabouts.
You do, do you?
Before I can reveal that information to you, you must pledge yourself to Rodcet Nife's service. Are you ready to make that commitment?

The other enemy was once the God of Health, but made a rather tragic mistake in her search for a way for life to extend to a never-ending state. In her research, she created undeath, and, for that crime, she was sentenced to a state of non-existence.

That is an excellent question. There have been rumors of her still existing and gathering her strength. This is unlikely, however, as once one has been sentenced to non-existence, one does not just walk out of it.
Rodcet Nife is also known as the Prime Healer.
Yes. How do you know of Anashti Sul?

This is troubling, indeed. We have heard such things, but haven't put much merit to them, until now. Will you go investigate this for us? This may be just the thing for you to prove your worth as a follower of the Prime Healer. Should the rumors be true, he will need to know the truth behind them.

npcs.name: Pupil Adept Wazzlefop
utterances: We're all very proud of you and your guild!  I'm afraid you've grown beyond the ramblings of a mere pupil.  You need to seek out my teacher Chronicler Steelwill.  I saw her around here somewhere. She'll continue your schooling. Goodbye, friend.

npcs.name: a Qeynos citizen
utterances: The Council hasn't said anything about the ratonga yet.  I wonder what's going on?
Are they here as spies?  Are they planning an attack?
Well, I for one, welcome our new ratonga neighbors!  Perhaps they could prove to be useful!
As much as they disgust me, I have heard that the ratonga have displayed remarkable intelligence.  Perhaps they might have something to offer after all.
Have you seen them?  I've heard that ratonga have been spotted in the city!
Argh, it's not enough that they filthy up Freeport, now they've come here to spread their disease and muck around our city?  PAH!

npcs.name: a Qeynos Guard officer
utterances: Almost time to stop and have an ale, isn't it?
Oh, my aching back!  As good a time to stop and chat as any, I say.
Treasures from the past can be found throughout the lands, for those who care to look.

npcs.name: a Qeynos representative
utterances: The guild registrar has been relocated from Qeynos Harbor to the old bakery shop here in South Qeynos. Please look for the sign, "The Coldwind Crier" across the street from Lion's Mane Inn and Tavern.
If you need to visit the embassy, the Sovereign House of Qeynos is located here within the residential district of South Qeynos.
If you are looking for a short stay in Qeynos. The Lion's Mane Inn and Tavern here in South Qeynos offers basic comfort at a great rate!
Welcome to Qeynos, traveler, know that you are among allies.
The city of Qeynos welcomes you!
I hope you have a great stay in the city of Qeynos.

npcs.name: a Qeynos resident
utterances: Through the advances in modern magic, anything is possible.
Happiness is an invention that doesn't blow up in your face.
To defeat the forces of chaos you must master your true inner calm.
An era of darkness has finally come to a close. Now we must see what future Norrath has in store.
Time spent with a kerra is never wasted.
Honest as a kerra, when the fish are out of reach.
It is better to swallow your pride than to lose your life.
Watch the tail!  Watch the tail!
You must completely devote yourself to the notions of truth and goodness.
It is easy to disperse hateful attitudes with an act of kindness.
As of late, my dreams show me visions of the lost city of Felwithe, and it is every bit as legendary as I would have imagined it.
Qeynos is a bastion of light in the darkness of the lands.  I hope you enjoy the sights of the city!
Good day, friend.  I always enjoy a good parlay.
Hail and welcome, I do hope your stay here is uplifting.
If it's not complex, you're not trying hard enough.
I'm listening. What is it?
Isn't that lovely?  It's just purrfect.
Salutations and warm greetings to you.
I bid you greetings and welcome to this place I call home.
It is a good day to tinker!
The winds carry voices of powerful foes and dragons of unimaginable strength and magic.
Confound those infernal gnomes and their diabolical gadgets!
It's hard enough to remember all of my calculations.  I'm supposed to remember their purpose, too?
Keep your ears open.
I've noticed you gawking at me.  Have you never seen a gnome before?
I'm dying to know what's in that castle.
Life's not all cogs and sprocket, you know.  There are fractions, too!
If it's not broken, then what did you do wrong?
Anyone can be clever, but only true geniuses can innovate.
I keep my wit as sharp as my claws.  I never know which one I will need to rely on.
Who would have known that one's paws could become so stained from pie?
If a gear is lost in a forest and no one can find it, did it ever exist to begin with?
It is good to understand your progress.  Voluntary limitations can enhance your personal growth.
The secret to creativity is knowing how to hide your sources - especially from the neighbors.
They're not so much rules as they are guidelines.
Hail, friend and well met. I do hope your visits are frequent. Too often do adventurers fail to return.
If my calculations are correct, the equation itself is wrong.
You must be cautious of the draws of evil.  We must master our temptations to preserve our city!
Patience and a proper attitude encourage fate to take a hand.
Good day to you. I trust your journey to our city was not overly hazardous.
Hail to you, friend. I hope you have many happy returns to our quaint town.
Invention is ninety-three percent perspiration, six percent explosion, and something else that I always forget.
How do you do! I am always pleased to meet a capable being, such as yourself.
Paradise has always been here on Norrath for those who are thoughtful and responsible for their actions.
We must preserve Qeynos.  If we do, a great victory will be upon us all!
I'm confident that the merchants of our city will fill all equipment needs with the utmost hospitality.
Hail, noble. It is with jubilation that I while away this time speaking with you.
We all must return to our origins.  Answering the questions of the past arms us to confront an uncertain future.
Hello, young adventurer. It is with the utmost delight that I greet you.
Hail, it is encouraging to see bright faces such as yours arrive in the everlasting city of Qeynos.
Hail, pleasure to meet you.
One day I'd like to explore every corner of the oceans.
I'm going to get some piercings so I can be unique like everyone else.
Greetings. Welcome to our asylum from the torment that plagues the lands of Norrath.
I wonder how efficient waterfalls would be to power a combustible chocolatizing confectionator?
It is with honor that I welcome you to our community.
Wonderful to make your acquaintance. Do you find this scenery as whimsical as I? The day is truly blessed.
Well met, friend.  It's good to make your acquaintance!
Wouldn't it be great if fruit was explosive?  It would be a wonderful power source and delicious at the same time!
Once I can get the steam to stop being hot,  I can give my invention to everyone!
What do you want? Leave me be!
As a citizen of the mighty city, Qeynos, I greet you openly.
Half-elves have the best of both worlds.
Well met, traveler. Has your journey to our village been a troublesome one?
You stand within the sturdy and unyielding walls of Qeynos, give thanks for their existence!
Well met. I find great solace in our meeting.
Welcome, adventurer. I pray you are peaceful and merry this day.
The Teir'Dal are so romantic,  the way they're all dark and gloomy...
I hope you find the day to your liking.
My ancestors don't understand me.  They're from a completely different era.
Truth will always be truth, regardless of the lack of understanding.
When darkness reigns across the face of Norrath, find solace in your inner light!
Another lovely day in the city of Qeynos!
Did you see that girl's hair?  Wow!

npcs.name: Quartermaster Lewyn
utterances: What can I do for you?
What type of mold do you have?

npcs.name: Queen Antonia Bayle
utterances: I did not know you had such wavering confidence in my leadership, Kyle Antihilus Bayle.
As rightful queen, I have something to enlighten the good citizens of Qeynos as well.
My most gracious citizens.
We are not weakened nor compromised in our endeavors.
In my time as Queen, we have overcome great threats and tyranny to find ourselves in an era of unity and prosperity.
All of us, here and abroad, wish to live free! And our combined power has seen us triumph time and again.
I implore you all to keep your aim true on the righteous path. Our power is in this united purpose.
Do not be lured astray by the false promises of Kyle Bayle and his kind.
If his heart was with the people he would share his knowledge, not use it as a threat to deliver my throne to him!
And I am flesh and blood. Kyle, in his now-immortal form, is nothing but a shade from our city's past... from my family's past.
We are the ones whose blood will spill. Not his. He bears no sacrifice or suffering.
Our past is proven! Do not be swayed! Divided we splinter, grow brittle and crumble.
Together, we are stronger than the heart of the Ironwood tree.
Together, we are the unshakable might and will of the entire forest.
Good citizen, thank you for your loyalty to Qeynos in her time of need.
Qeynos has great reason to be proud!

And we are all a part of that light, that shining beacon that illuminates Norrath and awakens her from her dark slumber.  As Norrath gently turns on her axis and revolves around the sun, each of us becomes a living light that guides all peoples into the Age of Destiny.  We are like the stars in the night sky.     For Qeynos must lead the way.  The ideals which we have championed are the one true hope for peace and prosperity in this world.  It is up to Qeynos to show all of Norrath what is possible when truth and justice, equality and mercy are enthroned.  I am merely a handmaid to the real rulers: our ideals.  These are what we look to for guidance.

And words cannot express the gratitude I feel ... to be entrusted with this august responsibility.  To stand here before you and before all of Qeynos fills me with great pride.  I know that we will seize every opportunity, this new year, to advance our cause and spread liberty throughout the land! We shall not dwell on failures of times past.  Instead we will live for the future.  Each of us will strive for the common good, and for the highest ambitions to which we can aspire!  This is the meaning of New Dawn Day!

npcs.name: Rachael Clothspinner
utterances: Huh?  Oh hello.  Hmmm, I know that needle is around here somewhere, but just in case, watch your step!
Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!
Welcome! What can I help you with?

npcs.name: Recruitment Officer Brandit
utterances: Greetings citizen, the Qeynos Guard stands tall amongst the protectors of this fine city!

npcs.name: Reigen MacKneel
utterances: Rawwwwr!  I'm a monster!
I'm not celebrating Nights of the Dead.  This is what I always wear!

npcs.name: a relieved Qeynos resident
utterances: Freeportians will learn the errors of their ways, one day.
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Qeynos still stands.
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
We can all breathe a sigh of relief. Norrath now has a new friend in the sky, and she keeps us safe from Kerafyrm's wrath.
May the gods continue to bless us.
I know there are those who wish harm upon Qeynos, but I just feel sorry for them.
Luclin shines so bright...
We must not doubt Queen Antonia. We owe much to her leadership!
Luclin is whole again... I never thought I'd see such a thing.
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Qeynos can't accomplish!
I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...

npcs.name: Remo Zigg
utterances: Leave me alone!
Go away!
And I left the Baubbleshire to get away from folks like you asking me questions!
Not dealing with you is important to me!
The answer is twenty-nine fiftieths of a bolt! Now go!
Nut! Now leave!
I have no idea!
Who?
Is it tension? Is it tension? It's tension, right?
Wait, how did I score?

npcs.name: Rendyl
utterances: For your own safety, Nettleville is off limits while the Circle of Ten investigate matters there.
Sorry, citizen, but by order of the Circle of Ten, I cannot allow you entrance.
I'm sure once order is restored in Nettleville you'll be able to return to your homes.

npcs.name: Rex Ironforge
utterances: Happy Erollisi Day to you, my good citizen!
Why would I want to do that?  If that was supposed to be a pickup line, you need to work on your material.
Ha!  I got that!  A paladin, amends!  Now say, that could be a pick up line.

Hah! As a matter of fact, I have worked on them docks, and, while I don't think we'd work out in that sense, I'll give you an 'A' for effort! If you feel you're smooth enough, you could always try charming Priestess Alena over by the Temple of Life.
Nah! It's just some harmless flirting, right? Besides, you could use the practice. You may have some smooth lines, but your delivery needs work. Now git goin'!

npcs.name: Rohn Tinkerton
utterances: I bet if I would have switched the flow of energy I might just have opened up the right portal. Oh well, I guess he was bound to find out one way or the other, Ha!

npcs.name: Roslyn Mischeva
utterances: What ho! Hail, my dear adventurer, my wonderful hero. You stand before Roslyn Mischeva, leader of this band of dirty misfits and talented raconteurs! May I say, you are in luck to have run into us at this fortuitous time!

Why is that? Well, it is none other than the Heroes' Festival, my good friend! And the Mischeva Play-Actors have been employed by the good people of Norrath to put together a show that properly celebrates the triumphs that the great heroes of this world have accomplished!

Yes, really! And the best part? The best part is YOU get to play the hero! The Mischeva Play-Actors will play the part of the nefarious antagonist! Will you help us? Will you swoop in to save the day from these terrible creatures?!

Just come as you are! You can find us nearly anywhere in Norrath, but we can't tell you when! That would spoil the surprise! Just stick to those places that you can handle, and we'll show up eventually!
Fantastic! We'll see you soon, <player name>!

npcs.name: Rrak Boldfist
utterances: There's so much chaos within our walls suddenly.  It is alarming, is it not?
Ah!  Tell her that there is an army of undead plaguing Starcrest Commune.

npcs.name: Rune Shimmerstar
utterances: What brings you to the Three Towers? Study of the arcane arts broadens your understanding of the world we live in. You would do well to remember this.
This is a very strange scroll. Very strange. But why bring it to me? Of course, I know many ancient tongues, but they're far too esoteric to be of any use to you.

I never said that! Oh, give it here and I'll see what can be done. Some room, please, while I cast this spell. Hmmm... Hmmm... the letter is coming through quite clearly now. Take it back to your captain. I'm sure she'll know what to do.

npcs.name: Sage Xoort
utterances: Hello there!  How can I be of service?
Nothing much, just a schematic I'm working on.  I can't find a power source for it ... Oh, Solusek's flame! How in the name of Brell can I make this thing work?

Fire's no good. It doesn't get hot enough or burn long enough.  WAIT!  HAH! Oh, you're right! I need a special type of coal.  You thought of it, so you can fetch it. I need still-burning embers from the forgotten guardians in the Forest Ruins.
Well?  What are you waiting for?  Go, go, GO!
So, you return with the coals ... I hope you didn't get burned! Let me take a look...

Oh yes! These shall work nicely!  Tell you what -- take this money for your work. I planned on buying a spell for creating a power source but because of your smart thinking and hard work, I need no spell!

npcs.name: Sayergei the Stylist
utterances: Come here, come here.  We simply must do something about your look!
That color?  Seriously...
That hair style... that choice of clothes... Sayergei isn't a wizard but this will take serious magic.

npcs.name: Scholar Demini
utterances: Yes, you must be one of those adventurers, all right.  If the stories about you folks are true, then I'm sure you're willing to undertake a dangerous task just for the thrill of it. Am I right?

npcs.name: Selwyn Oakheart
utterances: I'm sorry, dear. I don't think I'd be able to help you with anything right now. I'm very busy.

npcs.name: Sergeant-at-Arms Illervo
utterances: The Qeynos Guard pledge their lives to protect the city from darkness and chaos.

npcs.name: Sergeant-at-Arms Illervo
utterances: In service to the Qeynos Guard you have performed bravely and without concern for your own safety.

npcs.name: Sergeant-at-Arms Ironcast
utterances: I'm glad you made it back okay. I was beginning to worry.  New orders have come down for you.  You will need to report to Knight-Captain Steelgaze for special assignment.  Farewell, my friend, and congratulations!

npcs.name: Sergeant Geret Dalshinn
utterances: Greetings from the Order of Marr.  I am glad you have come, for I have a task of the utmost importance for those willing to embark upon a mission from the Queen.

I'm sure you have heard the rumors and stories of what has transpired in Freeport.  The chaos that consumes the city, the strife and turmoil in the streets, and ultimately, the disappearance of the Overlord himself, Lucan D'Lere.

We know little, as our spies have had difficulty gathering information, or have disappeared themselves.  However, from what we've been able to piece together, Lucan may have been betrayed by one of his own.  We think he was traded in a bid for power, but as to the mastermind, we are unsure.
No, the Queen has forbidden it.  In fact, she has asked for something much more surprising.  She has asked that we seek out the Overlord himself, and find a way to return him to Freeport.

The Queen has pondered all possible outcomes.  She believes that an assault on Freeport might prove successful, but the cost of innocent lives would be staggering.  Even now, innocents die in the bloodshed gripping the city, and we stand powerless to assist them.

Although it is run by tyranny, Freeport maintained a stable environment that acted as a shield for the innocent, so long as they were in line.  Fear of Lucan kept the various factions under control, which immediately began to vie for control once he was missing.  The innocent are no longer safe in anarchy.

We understand that all of this happened as soon as the damaged Ulteran Spires began functioning again.  I'm sure you've also heard that the erudite homeland of Odus has been found, trapped within the dimension of Ultera itself.  Although we don't have any direct evidence, we believe this might be the place to start.

There is an erudite scholar, Dalar R'taan, from whom we actually have received some information regarding Lucan.  He might be the one to speak to.  You can find him over near the Commonlands Ulteran Spires.

npcs.name: Seru Girondeaud
utterances: Tapping into divine power does not require giving yourself to a petty god.  Tapping into that power merely requires proper training and understanding, just like any discipline.

npcs.name: Shinolio
utterances: Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!
Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.

npcs.name: Slippery Toughshield
utterances: Look, the band is up and playing again. What happened?
He is still a little off tempo and wobbly, but I'll take it. You did fine work <player name>. Perhaps I can get you to do a little more for us.
We need to hand out more fliers advertising all the festivities, but they should be handed out with accuracy. What we need is the attendance of more heroes, this is a Heroes' Festival after all.
You need to locate promising looking individuals and give them the fliers. But a hero won't just take a flier, you must catch their attention by shoving it right into their face!
Absolutely! You have to be aggressive when it comes to heroes. Will you do it?
So how did it go? Did you use up all the fliers?
Excellent! Now we just sit back and wait for the crowd to start trickling in. Thanks again for your help and enjoy the festival!
There you are! Those fliers really did the trick. I would like you to do it again. We are on a roll!
What on Norrath am I going to do?
I am the manager of the minstrel band that is supposed to be putting on a show for the Heroes' Festival right now! But one of my band members is nowhere to be found.
His name is Gimit Delerg, and I would bet gold to flies that he is somewhere with his nose in a mug of ale. I took a quick look, but couldn't find him. Perhaps you could help.

npcs.name: Sneed Galliway
utterances: Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Welcome! What can I help you with?
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!
Step right up!  I've got all the adventuring garb you'll ever be needing outside the city gates!  The outside world is a dangerous place; make sure you're equipped to deal with the challenge!

npcs.name: Squire-Guard Williamson
utterances: You've done an excellent job defending the city. We owe you a debt of thanks.  We still have a lot of work  to do.  Go see Knight-Guard Rellin'thir, and he'll fill you in on the latest reports.  Well done, citizen!

npcs.name: Stable Hand Marcellun Iver
utterances: Come check out some of our new exotic mounts in the stable!
Does the one next to me catch your eyes? It has been a popular one in Qeynos!
Buy today and you'll receive a free feed bag!
Mounts fuuuur sale! Mounts fuuuur sale!
Down, boy! Down, boy!
As you can see we got few more helpers in the stable. The business has been good!
I have the finest selections in all of Qeynos!

npcs.name: Stable Hand Stonebear
utterances: Down, boy! Down, boy!

npcs.name: a stable helper
utterances: Pepper, you need to stay put and behave like the rest of your friends here.

npcs.name: a Starcrest gate watcher
utterances: Starcrest Commune is not to be entered until it is safe again.
Starcrest is a dangerous place now. It is not safe to enter.
There is a riot going on within Starcrest. No one is to enter until the matter is resolved.

npcs.name: Stetts
utterances: Welcome! What can I help you with?
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!
Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.

npcs.name: Steve Echar
utterances: Hello, friend.  Are you in need of repair?  My prices are very moderate.
Greetings there, have something that you think needs a bit of repair?
Hello there, friend.  Let me fix up that armor for you.
Hello there, my fine adventurer.  Just give me that armor right quick and I'll hammer it up good as new!
Hello, adventurer.  Looking to get some items repaired after a hard day of dragon slaying?
Welcome! Is there anything I can help you with or are you looking to find an apprenticeship?
Greetings, traveler!  If I can be of assistance please let me know.
Good day, traveler!  I trust you haven't been getting into any trouble.

npcs.name: Steward Aelin
utterances: Ah, an adventurer! I'm pleased that you've taken the time to speak with me.
My name is Steward Aelin, and I represent the Conservatory - a group of researchers dedicated to a rather incredible act of preservation. I am hoping that we can count on you for some help.

Well... perhaps it would be easier to just explain. Our society has taken charge of some of the creatures from within the Menagerie. It is our hope that we can learn more about the creatures that were within it, and the research that took place there.
The same. We had made great gains in understanding Miragul's notes on bonding with familiars and were poised to make even more remarkable ones, until it all came to a sudden and unexpected end.

He was, although his notes were somewhat incomplete. It seems that he had found an even more powerful bond between familiar and handler - one that could even be formed with those who didn't practice the arts of the arcane. Truly brilliant, Miragul was.
There was... there was an accident. Although I can't go into the details, we lost a significant portion of our housed creatures, and our keep was badly damaged.
We'd like you to recover the familiars, or at the very least, as many as you can.

Well... not necessarily. If you find them and bond with them, that might actually be the best outcome. Given all that has happened, we can no longer keep them in a secure place, and perhaps then the best alternative is for adventurers like yourself to make sure they are kept safe.

The Conservatory will pick up the pieces and attempt to continue our research as best that we can. Here, this book offers some information on who we are, and what we strive to do, as well as provide you a good list of what creatures escaped the keep. Perhaps one day, we can provide some more insight to the nature of the handler and familiar relationship.
Hello <player name>! I have a small task for you if you are interested.
We are seeking more creatures that could further our studies.  If you are willing, we need you to take these empty cages and capture some more familiar specimens for us.
Fantastic news, more specimens that will be a huge help in our research!

npcs.name: Stom Bluntblade
utterances: Ho, ho, the weather is fine and the ale is cold.  What more can you ask for?

npcs.name: Sweeny
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Tabby Copperpot
utterances: Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Confound it! Where did I put that ledger?  It must be around here somewhere!
Welcome! What can I help you with?

npcs.name: Talas Farin
utterances: Do not fear us.  We are as loyal to Qeynos and the Queen as you.

npcs.name: Talit
utterances: Why, hello.  Is there something I can help you with?
Ah yes... the palace work.  Great that it looks so much better.  Just great.
Oh, sure there are.  But look at it!  The most work was done on the palace itself.  It figures.  Those above us always look out for themselves first.
A bit, but it's nothing compared to the palace.  It's just like I said, the Queen looking out for herself.

npcs.name: Tara Ironforge
utterances: Hello, friend! I've just received some fine gems from the hard-working dwarves in the village! Take a look. See if anything strikes your fancy.

npcs.name: Tatterhorn
utterances: Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!

npcs.name: Tawli Whiskwind
utterances: Good day to you, deary!  I make the most wonderful brooms--strong bristles, stout handles, and quite stylish if you ask me.  Great for sweeping off your doorstep or scaring off little critters!

npcs.name: Telamoninioon Orinsidian
utterances: Good day <player name>, what brings you to the Concordium?

npcs.name: Templar Calmarath
utterances: Preposterous!  Ale-soaked barbarians....

Inquisitor Loffren, or "Battle Cleric" Loffren as he and his ilk refer to themselves!  The gall of him, claiming to spread the word of the gods all the while soaked in blood and other remnants of war!

Bah! Of course there is! By tending to the wounded, not making more wounded! Or by bringing comfort to friends and comrades in their last moments, not raining death down on others. Clerics bring the word and lessons of the gods to the faithful, not go running around reveling in combat. We should be guides and guardians of the soul, not weapons of war.

The blasphemous altars of Rallos Zek, Cazic-Thule, or foul Innoruuk should be all the warning one needs of glorifying battle in the name of one's god.  This is a dangerous road the Council has started to walk down, and if we're not careful the price could be great.
Mark my words: this compromise of our discipline is an error. The greatest of oaks can be felled by rotting the core of its being, and the Council is inviting this corruption in.

npcs.name: Tevan Brassgear
utterances: Ah, here you are.  We've been waiting for you.

Age's End grows ever nearer, and the Duality is still working to counter the threat.  We are working with him to find the answers, but he has asked that you be summoned to assist further in his research.
He is conducting his studies apart from the general business of the city, so I will need to take you to him.  Let me know when you are ready.

npcs.name: Thierry Dillon
utterances: Excuse me?

npcs.name: Thompson
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Thorson
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Tibby Copperpot
utterances: More baked goods coming right up!
Mm, doesn't that just smell delicious?
A baker's work is never done!

npcs.name: Tilla
utterances: We're finally beginning to carve out a place for ourselves here, but we still have long way to go.

npcs.name: Tilliana Steamsieve
utterances: Well, hello hello <player name>, welcome to the Concordium.  What can I do for you today?

npcs.name: Toranim Skyblade
utterances: Greetings, adventurer.  It's good to see citizens visiting the Temple of Life.  Many great blessings can come from following the doctrines taught here.

npcs.name: Trilin
utterances: Without the Qeynos Guard to shield it, the Concordium would fall beneath the blades and arrows of our enemies.
The Qeynos Guard pledge their lives to protect the city from darkness and chaos.

npcs.name: Trina Tinkerton
utterances: Busy, busy, busy... I am much too busy right now. OH! If I switch these wires here... No, no... Oooh that would have been bad, teehehehe!

npcs.name: Tristan Galliway
utterances: Do I know you?

npcs.name: Tyluna Whittlebit
utterances: Howdy, back at you.
Never gonna give up on true love, eh?  Hehehe.  Well, I don't blame ya, but what makes you think you're my type?
My, that was embarrassing!  Well, I love my kitties.  Oh, and I craft little figurines... mostly of kitties, mind you!
And all of nature, really.  I enjoy listening to birds sing, walking in dew damp grass, watching the tide come in –Nature in its entire splendor!

npcs.name: Tysha Rowan
utterances: We've all the basic supplies that you'll ever need.  Are you looking for anything specific?
You look like you need help.  Can I help you find something?

npcs.name: Uhmar
utterances: Uhmar dances for the pretty lady!

npcs.name: Ulir
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Urach
utterances: Duty above all else citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Varion Smitelin
utterances: Interested in the magical arts, are you?
Good. That's what I like to hear! I'm working on a levitation spell, but I'm running low on Bog Faeries. If you go to the Peat Bog and round up some of the wings, I'll gladly pay you for this deed.
Fabulous!  I need a handful of the wings to restock my supply. Good luck in that nasty bog and be careful!

npcs.name: a visiting dignitary
utterances: It brings comfort to my heart to see you come to us in safety.

npcs.name: a visiting traveler
utterances: A hard day of adventuring makes one long for home, don't it?
Treasures from the past can be found throughout the lands for those who care to look.
Treasures from the past can be found throughout the lands, for those who care to look.
Give me the simplicity of life as the kerra once knew it, and I'll be satisfied.
I'm not used to this weather, but my people can adapt to any change in order to survive.
Ah, what I wouldn't give to cradle a mug of good Dwarven Ale just now.

npcs.name: Vixxi Starguide
utterances: Good day to you.
Really?!  How exciting!  Has my perfect match been found, yet?
Oh.  So, no luck finding a handsome, muscled man that wants to spend time with me?  I tell ya, a pair of broad shoulders walks by, and my knees buckle.
Well, yeah.  Oh, is that wrong?  Should I say something more brainy?  I care about the poor and map-less, too.

npcs.name: Vondorinsarnoo
utterances: We are coping with the recent events...  some in better ways than others.  Take that poor drunk, Hubert, across the way for instance...
His faith is shaken, and he's suffered insurmountable hardships and loss.  I could help this poor soul, but first, I must remove him from his drunken stupor.
I'll write in your journal what I need from the local Peat Bog. I'll create a concoction so foul that he'll expel what resides in his belly.
He'll speak more clearly with that rotgut out of his stomach.

npcs.name: Walter Channing
utterances: Greetings, friend traveler! We have the finest supplies to fill your adventuring needs.
Welcome! What can I help you with?
Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!
May I interest you in seeing some of the fine armor and weapons that made the Ironforge family famous?

npcs.name: Warley Theodoric
utterances: My stein hasn't any legs to walk over and fill itself up.
What do you mean ye drank more than I did?
Hurry up! My stomach's near dry thanks to ya.
I could use another ale for the road anytime now.

npcs.name: Wimbell Tozer
utterances: Would you look at that! It's reprehensible. Opprobrious! Downright despicable! Such an ignobility is an affront to the very precepts the Concordium expounds!

Look there, see her? No, wait! Don't look at her! Oh no, she just looked over here! It's all over! Now she's going to scramble my brains and make me think I'm a chicken. Or worse, a clockwork chicken!

Yori Boswick! She's one of Malevini Darlyner's new apprentices. Oh sure, she may look sweet and all, but behind that facade she calls a face, there's nothing there but calculating deceit formulating in that noggin of hers.

Proof? You mean like physical, tangible, irrefutable truth? I.. I... Well, no, I don't have anything indisputable just yet. However, I have heard several rumors which I aim to prove as being the indisputable truth!

They say Malevini hails from Freeport. Apparently she angered the wrong people there when Lucan D'Lere went missing. It's been said that she blamed members of the Lucanic Knights for not adequately protecting their leader.

All kinds of things! Some say she actually welcomed Lucan's disappearance! Others say she took delight in the violence and anarchy left in the ensuing fallout. I even heard that there's a hefty price on her head! Whatever the case, it's clear she is no longer welcome in Freeport.

Keep your voice down! You don't want Yori to report what we're discussing to that mind-melting witch, do you? Alright, don't tell ANYONE this, but I heard, from a very reputable source, that Malevini used her dark craft to warp the minds of the Council in order to convince them to allow her to stay in Qeynos.

Oh, I do say! I do! What's worse is that a few people, and I'm not naming names, but a few people say she's actually a double-agent for Freeport! They say her "exile" was actually concocted by the Overlord himself! Who knows what sort of clandestine schemes Malevini has planned!?
Can you fathom such diabolism!? A spy, pretending to be an exile from Freeport, arriving at our gates, asking for amnesty! Hmph! I don't buy it! No, siree, not one bit!

Oh, sure. There are several who disagree with me. "Her willingness to teach the art of coercion to members of the Concordium is a noble offering!" I hear them cry. Nevermind the fact that it was her ONLY bargaining chip when she pleaded for the Council to allow her to remain in the city! Bunch of malleable bleeding-hearts they are.
Watch your back, friend. Better yet, watch your mind. It may not be your own much longer!
Paranoia is reality seen on a finer scale. Perfect paranoia is perfect awareness. Paranoia can be instructive in the right doses. Paranoia is a skill!

npcs.name: a wonderstruck Qeynos resident
utterances: We must not doubt Queen Antonia. We owe much to her leadership!
Luclin is so beautiful... but it's terrifying to know what she harbors within.
See! We never needed Freeport's help! Queen Antonia can do it all on her own!
Kerafyrm is still up there... trapped, but for how long?
Look upon our great city! Threatened time and time again, but Qeynos still stands.
The night sky is so different now, I love it!
If we can make Luclin whole, then there is nothing that Qeynos can't accomplish!
I know there are those who wish harm upon Qeynos, but I just feel sorry for them.
Freeportians will learn the errors of their ways, one day.
Luclin shines so bright...
Even if the shissar found a way off Luclin, Queen Antonia wouldn't let any harm come to us.
I can look up at Luclin and know I will never see Kerafyrm's shadow again.
Luclin... it kind of looks like an egg now, doesn't it? I hope Kerafyrm cannot get free...
I heard some have found a way to Luclin. It is a new beginning for us now!
May the gods continue to bless us.
Luclin represents an end to the war, an end to the Awakened. We must thank her.

npcs.name: Woodrow
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.
Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Wynia Vethe
utterances: Learning for the sake of learning is still learning.

npcs.name: Yori Boswick
utterances: Good day <player name>, what brings you to the Concordium?
